author: {'steamid': '76561198014992391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2059, 'last_played': 1660049648}
review:
ただ全てが自由なサンドボックスではなく、しっかりとしたストーリーを備えた2Dサバイバルクラフトゲーム。
基本的な操作やクラフトについてはベーシックな作りとなっており、類似作をプレイしてきた方なら戸惑うことなくプレイできるだろう。
キャラメイクではそれぞれ個性的な特徴がある種族を選択することができるため、時間をかけて楽しめるだろう。

ワールドは単一のマップではなくワールドマップがあり、その中で固定生成されたマップ（村やダンジョン）でクエストを行い、森や草原のようなランダム生成のマップで資源採掘やハウジングを行う形。
地域ごとのメインストーリーをこなしていくことで新たな地域（そして資源）が開放されるのだが、クエストに興味はなくただ単純にサバイバルクラフトとして遊びたい人向けに、ランダムドロップの地図を集めることでも地域の開放が可能となっている。

本レビュー作成時点では日本語ローカライズはされていないが、クエスト文章などは中学英語レベルで理解できる程度。
ジャーナルにも端的にどこで何をどうしろとまとめてくれるので、そうそう困ることはないだろう。
作中には世界観を説明した書物や秘匿された宝物のヒントを記したメモなどが多数あるのだが、これをじっくり読もうと思うと腰を据えて取り組むことになるかもしれない。

クラフトはスキル制のシステムとなっており、素材があってもスキルが足りないと作成できないという難点はあるが、ドロップやチェストからスキル経験値を付与する巻物が得られるため、意図してスキル上げすることは頻繁にはない（多少はある）

メインシナリオはリニアなものではあるが、サイドクエストもそれなりにあるので全部をこなしていこうと思うとかなりの時間を費やすことになるだろう。
ただし大体のサイドクエストはお使い的なものが多く、地域によっては何度も行き来をさせられる面倒なものもあるのだが、日数で結果が変わるようなものはなさそうなので、飽きてしまったクエストは後回しにしてしまってもよいだろう。

日本超ローカライズされていないことで敷居は高いと思われるが、ストーリーがなかなかに面白いので少しでも興味を持たれた方はぜひともプレイしていただきたい。

（メインクエストクリア後追記）
メインクエストを完走した感想だが、非常にオーソドックスなRPGキャンペーン1本をクリアしてヒロイックなエンドを迎えたという印象。
すべてのAchievementを開放したい場合はそれなりに稼ぎプレイが必要だが、ストーリーを楽しむだけならば40～50時間程度だろうか。

これから始めようと思う方へのアドバイスとしては、
　・時間がかなり掛かるので畜産、農業（特に果物の木の育成）は早めに始めること
　・食事はキャラビルドに合わせたものを欠かさず食すこと
　・Alchemyは育てば金になる
といったところ。他にも有益な情報がコミュニティのガイドにあるので、英語ではあるが是非チェックしてほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998945945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3120, 'last_played': 1659054491}
review:
好玩之處: 練技能、製作裝備、沙盒建造
中庸: 交易、種植、挖礦
難玩: 控制、戰鬥、任務

總結: 給喜歡練技能+製作的玩家，戰鬥或沙盒相較另一款T字頭遊戲弱，但練技能+製作裝備較強。
普通難度30小時以內可以破關，重玩度較低，除非有改版。

以下難玩點 + 個人克服方式
任務，(目前只有英文)需要閱讀但文字量不大，只是像素字體不舒服。
開局選種族純 Gameplay，不影響情任務，個人選人類跳過1/4的練技能時間。
自動儲存必自行調整，不然影響遊戲體驗。
技能控制，技能超過 3個加上近戰很不上手，我把控制數字 2-6 改為右鍵，戰鬥較為順暢，但採集模式快捷列變成不方便。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026517505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 27460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1706833077}
review: As good as Terraria or Minecraft, but also just as confusing with regards to mechanics. It took me almost an hour to figure out how to chop trees because I tried equipping the hatchet to my active bar instead of my character sheet, just for example. That aside, solid make-your-own-fun sandbox game, and the possibility of the story progression seems interesting without being oppressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176738205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1680080952}
review:
It's alright, I have three problems though.

1. Human type enemies are really easy to fight. Usually they move, stand still, swing, move or something like that. It's just really easy to avoid them and I wish there was some kind of difficulty slider to ramp up how aggressive they act.

2. Short races such as Dwarfs, Goblins, and Gnomes aren't actually short? These races will be the exact same height as other races, can't the devs just make them one block shorter or something? 

3. No multiplayer, I feel like this would be a great game to play with friends. Simple as.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987906597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1660255708}
review:
I made a short video review of the game (based on release version 1.0.4 - 1.0.6.

https://youtu.be/Z2MWvv2CocI

Summary: 

Realms of Magic is a fun entry into the 2d Sandbox RPG/Action Adventure category. Anyone that enjoys Terraria, Starbound or It lurks Below will no doubt find enjoyment playing it. 

There's plenty of options when it comes to skill trees and I really like the focus on the RPG-orientated features. 

My early impressions are really good, but I'll be playing through the main story in the coming weeks. Once I've completed it, I'll note any issues if they arise.
------------------
------------------
Update 1 - August 5th - Current Version: 1.0.7

I've played around 15 hrs at this point and I'm still enjoying the game. I'm doing a lot of quests and periodically going back to a little homestead that I've built in the first area. There's a couple of buildings and farming patches for me to keep on top of. 

Some minor criticisms: 
-Cheesing and kiting is often too easy. Kiting is as you'd expect, but cheesing is outrageously easy at times. You can outwit a lot of enemies by simply standing on a platform a few blocks above them. They'll remain stationary and let you kill them with mage. 

-Although I'm glad to see quests implemented in the way they are, I've noticed by now (up to act iv in the story) that the quests can be pretty tedious. The typical pattern tends to be: talk to NPC > Go to place > kill someone or retrieve item > go back to NPC. They're not very dynamic, and the story isn't all that captivating. Some of the dialogue is clever and well written, though. 

-The way NPCs (Companions) are just found in the wilderness and follow you until you drop them off could use some attention. These NPCs can also be duplicates (I've got two carpenters at my homestead), They have nothing in their inventories to trade with. They stay rooted where you leave them and don't interact with the environment. I'm hoping that I'm missing something and these NPCs will come to life in the future. 
--EDIT: 1.0.7 patched the empty inventory problem. All companions that are docked at my homestead now have an inventory to trade with.-- 

That's it for now. I'll probably do one more update after I've finished the main story. 
------------------
------------------
Update 2 - August 10th - Current Version: 1.0.7

I've been spamming the game, and really enjoying it. Luckily there were no glaring issues (there were certainly a few near misses). I've completed the main quest of the game, clocked about 45 hours of playtime and feel pretty content with the whole experience. Here are some notes below: 

-Sometimes the quest objectives marked in the journal lack clarity. There's a quest that I was stuck on for a long time, where I had to find a guy in a 'bear hide hat'. It was a total red herring. The guy I needed to find didn't seem to be wearing a hat at all. A quest towards the end of the penultimate act involved gathering crystals. I thought that the game glitched and wouldn't trigger the NPC dialogue, as I'd beaten a boss in the area that presumably had the last item I needed before turning it in. It turns out there was a loose corpse of some rando enemy that had one of the crystals I needed. In instances such as this, it might be advisable to put an animation on 'special' corpses. A shimmering effect would go a long way. Even just having a counter like 'You have collected 5 out of 8 of X item' would save so much confusion. The journal entries were usually fine, but sometimes unhelpful as noted above. 

-I encountered a bug where my homestead was completely wiped. Now, luckily, I countered the problem by reverting to an older save and didn't have to retread much ground, but If I had to go through hours of gameplay again, this would have been a dealbreaker for me. Thankfully, it appeared to be a one-off, but if I lost everything that I'd been building between quests and exploration that would have seriously sucked! 

-Late down the line, given the right prerequisites, you may unlock a permanent buff called 'Divine Intervention'. To put it bluntly, this tilts the game into easy-mode.The buff saves your life if you receive a killing blow. This buff needs to be nerfed. I would change the cooldown so it's at least a minute. I think it's currently 10 seconds, which is nothing. You can step out of a fight and back in with almost zero consequence. Also, I would consider setting a limit on how many times this skill can be used per in-game day. It's OP. 

-Some more minor issues include: 
*Lots of typos in quest dialogue. 
*Walking back and forth for quests can be tedious. The game would certainly benefit from having teleports/waypoints in bigger maps. 
*Minor visual glitches can occur, such as corpses that bounce indefinitely on terrain, or animations that don't cease (even after entity death). 
*The autosave is a little too triggerhappy. It often saves during combat. 

And that's it, really. Had a great time with this game. It's right up my alley. If, like me, you're a massive fan of Terraria, and you're looking for a new game to scratch that itch, this is definitely worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011206241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1659022579}
review: I played for 8+ hours yesterday. Saved multiple times, died a few times, was able to reload from previous saves. Start it up today and every save file is gone and all of my progress wiped.
developer_response: Game can be run in two modes, with and without Steam, and both use different save locations. Please try running the game with and without Steam. To run with Steam, just press Play button in Steam, to run it without, you need to manually run exe file from the game's installation folder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046657855', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 7816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7369, 'last_played': 1677866553}
review:
Disappointing, honestly.

On first impression when I looked it up a few years ago I was hyped that a game with seemingly complex RPG mechanics in 2D format landed on early access, one that would later include both a sandbox mode and an open world RPG. It looked promising, systems were varied and unique, overall something worth getting excited over.

And then I actually tried to beat all the quests in the game.

Long story short? 

- Shoddy English writing likely done by people with no script checking leading to both dull dialogues and sometimes outright broken ones.
- BOREDOM. Sure, some quests involve a few interesting twists, however given that despite the open-ness illusion it feels very limited in the way you could tackle missions or choose to react to the world. Sometimes you are allowed to go against NPC wishes with minimal consequences, other times you don't even get that option. Other than that there's no fun to any of the quests, there is a small amount of exception to some that utilize a few mechanics to makes things exciting, but for the most part its "go here and kill X stuff" or "fetch me this Y".
- BROKEN (Sometimes). To put it simply: My play time is rather high because I already had to do several runs because sometimes quests would just not be possible at the moment to complete due to major, sometimes not even bug related problems that would lead to a quest that cannot be accomplished. Sure, they'll get fixed eventually, but that doesn't change the fact that this would be AFTER the proper release of the game outside of early access it still got released pretty messy.
- Oh yeah, and turns out all the varied skill systems are just number crunching. It's like skyrim but with no unique equipment or skills that really stand out.

Final recommendation? Wouldn't bother with this even on sale.
Felt like a waste of time playing, and I do not wish the same fate on anyone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966319532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1658950451}
review:
£15 is a bit steep for what you get, £10 and below its alright.

Combat is super basic and enemies are varying levels of brain dead (you can literally "hug" some of them and they cant attack you).
Once you complete the first area you'll basically be doing that on repeat for the rest of the game.
Crafting is irrelevant as you'll find superior or good enough gear easily.

Im not super impressed but if you can get it cheap it'll fill a few hours.
A resounding "Its alright".

author: {'steamid': '76561198211249024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2225, 'last_played': 1659476144}
review: Genuinely a ton of fun. The progression feels rewarding and there's a huge variety of builds. The world is surprisingly large with a new type of enemy or area always around the corner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033007064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3143, 'last_played': 1671628365}
review:
Really loving this one. It's an RPG that looks like Terraria, but it removes the action/boss parts to replace them with crafting skills and talent points in a way that is similar to runescape (with new unlocked recipes/tiers when you reach a specific level). It's quite casual: trouble won't come looking for you, it's you who is setting the pace. The main maps (probably ~100 of those) are hand-crafted and contain NPCs, quests, secrets etc, and the other maps are randomly-generated sandbox areas in which you can do whatever you like: building your home/base, farming, mining for resources, looking for buried treasures... 

Only complaint is that in the current state of the game, the sandbox areas don't provide much exploration fun: they're all extremely similar, only the tier of resources/loot vary. Once you've seen a couple of them, you've seen them all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202811822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1660758389}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142461575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1700717261}
review: I gotta say, I am absolutely loving this game. There is no specific way you need to play, because you have so many freedoms. After 8 hours, I have only just completed a small chunk of the game because I was so distracted with building my own home out in the woods and furnishing it. Skill leveling is very satisfying, and the crafting system is simple yet fun. Personally, I feel this game could have so much more with workshop support, but even without it it is a fantastic game! I plan to put much more hours into this and look forward to seeing what happens in future acts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167938746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1659360349}
review: Realms of Magic is great through and through. I think mist other reviews have hit the nail on the head; terraria meets elder scrolls with passionate developers and more polish by the day. It may be a bit smaller in scope than terraria, but the gameplay feels more tight and focused for this reason. The story, different starting races, and skills that level with use make this a gem. I am excited to spend many more hours fighting, exploring, harvesting, and crafting. The flexibility with character builds is enticing, and the amount of craftables is vast. The survival mechanics are thoughtfully implemented to help more than hinder. Please buy and support this game and devs, so it gets the lifetime support it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092519168', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1659869527}
review:
[b]Eh toi là, tu es fan de Terraria, tu aimes l'exploration de Starbound et le farming de Stardew Valley alors je t'invite à t'arrêter 2 petites minutes pour lire ce review !![/b]

[list][*]Plongez à l'époque médiévale dans un monde où le mal et les monstres gouvernent, tu vas devoir survivre et explorer dans un monde ouvert, tout en aidant tes semblables pour progresser dans différentes zones du monde et oui, va falloir être sociable …

[*]Le jeu offre un large choix de gameplay via c’est 7 différents arbres de talent. Divers choix d’armure et d’arme sont à ta disponibilité, du Guerrier ultra résistant en armure lourde, au Mage en tissu ou bien encore un Assassin DPS. Si tu te cherches encore un peu ou si tu es atteint de trouble de la personnalité le jeu te permet de créer ton Set d’armure qui te convient le mieux. Ah oui aussi, j’ai oublié de préciser qu’il existe 9 races différentes avec des passives respectives pour chacune d’entre elle lors de la création de ton personnage, donc si tu as toujours voulu faire ressortir ton côté gnome Mage des pieds et guerrier de la tête, je pense que tu seras heureux.

[*]Vu que tu dois te sociabiliser bien évidemment les PNJ, euh les villageois te donneront des quêtes à accomplir, le jeu est très centré sur les quêtes pour pouvoir progresser donc évite de les ignorer petit filou. Niveau mob il y a de quoi faire t’inquiète, pareil niveau DJ et si le jeu est vraiment trop simple, tu peut changer de difficulté en hard ou alors si tu es un PGM tu peux custom ta difficulté.

[*]Tu es la réincarnation de Valérie Damidot ? Alors le jeu va te plaire, beaucoup d'élément de décoration sont à disposition, tu peux build de la façon que tu veux, après bon ce n'est pas architecte simulator et on est sur un jeu de type pixel/cubic donc les constructions restent quand même limitées. 

[*]Farmeur de l’extrême dans l’âme ? Eh bien écoute, tu as 16 métiers différents a monter. Voilà que dire de plus, ah si jusqu’au niveau 100, si ça te motive encore plus quand je te dis ça et oui ton perso a des niveaux a monté si ça ne te suffit pas.[/list]

[b][u]Point Négatif/Point à améliorer :[/u][/b]

[list][*]Le jeu mériterait en tant que bon français une grosse mise à jour de traduction pour introduire le Français et plusieurs autres langues (L’Anglais est la seul langue disponible). 

[*]Le jeu dispose de beaucoup de dialogue donc si tu as trop de mal à comprendre l’Anglais attend la traduction du jeu en Français sinon pour les novices/amateurs de l’Anglais les dialogues utilisent de l’Anglais très simple à comprendre et puis ça ne te fera pas de mal de lire un peu d’Anglais non ? Pour les bilingues, vous avez de la chance d’être bilingues voilà.

[*]Malheureusement, il ne se joue actuellement qu’en solo et il a toutes les qualités pour être multijoueur. Mais ne t'inquiète pas, tu n’auras pas le temps de t'ennuyer.

[*]Les combats sont peut-être un peu trop linéaires, il ne faut pas que tu t’attendes à avoir des combats à la Elden Ring désolé.[/list]

Bon aller, je ne t’en dis pas plus, je te laisse découvrir par toi-même un jeu qui en vaut le détour et puis si il ne te plaît pas, tu sais il y a toujours le remboursement Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046732291', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1658943370}

author: {'steamid': '76561198824912910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1659060343}
review:
The game have a deep mechanic mixing together characteristics that work and flow well together.

 You two types of instances with protected and sandbox modes. Quest related instances like: Cities, dungeons, settlements are protected(You cannot break blocks), while normally wild places are sandbox. This reflects well into the gameplay, since the player can alternate between combat and tool/sandbox mode. I love this.

 But on the other hand, I feel like you should only permit fast travel from cities and player-made settlements, but not let player instantly fast travel into unknown lands. I miss a bit of difficulty to move around, because travelling through the world map feels like a super power. Not a problem at all, but that would increase the immersion, you could give the character the "need" to build a sign in the place in order to fast travel there. Exploration feels rewarding. Make a "portal" in both ends that allow you to move through the map.

 There is not much variety of weapons, there is a moderate to few amount of armor/outfit and few skills. The game can use more skill trees, and more skills for the existing.

 Art style is beautiful, the disposal of colors is a breeze, character design is good.

 Soundtrack is good enough.

 Quests are generic and basic, you don't have a organic feeling into it. There should be more quests than only kill and bring materials. You could defend, scout, build, build a house to someone into a wild place, a faction side quest with a settlement you build yourself. The sky is the limit.

 In general, the price is ok and I feel like it is a fair deal.

 I don't feel like it is an complete game, but one of the best ideas and designs that I've came across. Congratulations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972303336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1658931753}
review:
It's just Starbound all over again. Stale environments, poor procedural generation (enemies/NPCs literally spawn mid-screen when exploring a forest), very little depth of content. All of these things would be tolerable with a fun core game-play loop, but it doesn't have one. Combat is terrible, quests are monotonous, and exploration is pointless.

Oh and the auto-save feature literally freezes the game for ~2 seconds every time it runs, and interferes with the controls after it un-freezes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010458837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1660062825}
review: This game is really addictive. I didn't really like Terraria, but I do like this one with every tile on the map being its own randomly generated area that saves its state after you visit it. Its like having hundreds of terraformable worlds at your fingertips. Also has a pretty decent crafting system, not too grindy but just enough to make you actually want to stay up way too late getting to the next tier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024511522', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2927, 'last_played': 1706488202}
review: I was not expecting this game to be as good as it is. I am 48hrs in and cant get enough of it. I Wouldnt mind a remastered or upgraded version of this game with slightly better graphics and a more detail system on top of the one that is there, For instant kingdom or village management for those of us who recruited npcs and a increase to the skill options and along with a better pixel  detail to the characters. But the amount of races they have is amazing along with the different type of building blocks you can make though I feel it needs to be upgraded as it feels like this game is missing some things that are needed for some of the building materials. I also like the named weapon system in this, The weapons dropped from powerful foes are cool in their own respect. An should be expanded upon. In truth there really isn't anything really bad about the game except for when your building to fast and the game itself cant keep up. But other then that Everything is amazing and I would like to see every part of this game expanded upon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025276275', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1658853835}
review:
Tried but can't like it. I often find myself closing the game and promising to come back later, not a really good sign. I don't know if the problem is being subpar with Terraria/Starbound, or the glacial pacing due to going back and forth because the unperked stamina bar is just trash

Quests are a nice adition, but it's mostly fetch and slay. When I got a "provide x amount of seeds" as a quest I rushed to my built house. It took a while because it's in the middle of the map and I can't access it right away, even having a bed there. Upon arrival I talked to my only NPC, a seed seller. To my surprise his inventory was wiped, maybe because of the latest patch, don't know...

That made put put things in perspective. Is this the kind of experience I'm looking when I launch a game? Does it looks like a full release experience? Not to me, so I'll let it soak for a while and hope the devs fix their game. Until there I would say this game is a no go

author: {'steamid': '76561198018342860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1658861801}
review:
В цілому непоганий гібрид 2D пісочниці та лінійної RPG, який, якщо зайде, може затягнути на багато годин. Але грі не вистачає відполірованості та деякі ігрові функції мають не найкращу реалізацію. Грі я би поставив оцінку "добре". Коротко про плюси та мінуси, на мою думку:

Сподобалось:
+ Сюжетна лінія, яка хоч і лінійна, але допомагає з прогресом та вносить різноманітність у ігровий процес, поступово розкриває гру
+ 2D пісочниця, в який є чим зайнятись: копання, майстрування, будування, фермерство - все це з прокачкою професій
+ Підземелля, битви, різноманітні вороги
+ Прокачка персонажа із деревом навичок, можна створити різні типи персонажів
+ Приємна піксельна графіка та прийнятний саундтрек

Не сподобалось:
- Бойовка не вражає різноманітністю та реалізацією, щей необхідно активувати скіли перед використанням - щоб пульнути файрбол, не достатньо натиснути одну кнопку, треба спочатку змінити активний скіл під ліву або праву кнопку миші, а це зайвий клопіт і все сповільнює
- Дерева талантів занадто прості і нецікаві
- Загадки у дусі платформерів на перманентних локаціях напрягають. Єдиний вихід брати расу гоблін, у якого є подвійне підстрибування одразу (у інших рас відкрити подвійне підстрибування можна не раніше 30 рівня). Але гоблін має найслабші расові риси.
- Расові відмінності погано пропрацьовані
- У версії 1.0 відсутня можливість скинути таланти - тому якщо вам не сподобалось, що ви там набирали - упс! Обіцяють додати у 1.1.
- Підгальмовування, незначні баги ще присутні

author: {'steamid': '76561198009130616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1659289442}
review:
Its a fun game but it certainly needs optimization. 

If you have a nearly fully inventory and craft a bunch of items the game stutters quite severely as the crafted items get thrown to the ground. After selling some items, causes the ground items to fly to the player, the stutter occurs again. 

Some of the dialog options are... interesting. 

Crafting / leveling up looks like it can become tedious. I might end up installing an autoclicker or  a tool to mimic my mouse's movements for all these repetitive clicking. 

Overall its good for the cost. The developer(s) put a lot of work into this and it shows. I look forward to future patches.

review:
Edit: The link the dev shared helped me figure it out. I can save the game without a crash, wonderful! Loving the game so far, looking forward to it.

I really want to play this game! It crashes 100% of the time when I try to save the game though. I tried reinstall, tried checking integrity of the files, even installed on a different hard drive on the same computer. No luck. Got it on my wishlist so I don't forget about it.. Might buy it again in a year or so and see if it's been fixed (or I'm luckier?). Such a bummer, looks really fun.
developer_response:
This is known issue caused by Windows, you can find the fix here:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/490280/discussions/0/3464974615678974346/

author: {'steamid': '76561198027362214', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1658938671}
review:
[h1] Not Usually Into 2D Games... [/h1]

...but I'm making an exception for this one. 

I'm sold on the questing - haven't done much crafting as yet, but that will come I suspect when I actually get around to building my base of operations!

Great music too which would feel at home in an AAA title.

Haven't come across any bugs as such, others are harping on about although there seems to be a gap in looping ambient sounds and the pause on auto save which others have picked up on. Also I don't think broadcast is turned on for the game. I'd like to watch others play sometime. Props to the writing though, haven't seen a single typo which usually plagues these games and ultimately puts me off due to the unnecessary sloppiness.

Keep up the good work otherwise!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970627522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1659412498}
review:
Thus far I'd say this is a must buy for fans of Terraria, five hours in and I'm sure to get many more.

Edited to say the following:

After 50 hours in this game, I can safely say that it has all the pieces to be a must have in the Terraria-like genre. It could use some balancing, loot is underwhelming and combat a little on the easy side with tier appropriate gear in my experience with a spear user. If they made combat a little tougher, which may be possible just with AI improvements then bumping the loot from chests up one tier would make the various tiers more interesting to explore.

There is more to it, but the fact that there aren't awesome set bonuses for gear makes it so much less enjoyable to hunt chests for loot. The bumping up of loot and seeds to  the next tier would smooth that aspect out, but might make crafting feel less enjoyable. Set bonuses could fix that, since you'd be able to make a full set so much easier than finding one. Nothing a few patches can't sort, long term.

There are foods  that need sinks, cabbage could use a fermenting recipe, and corn currently only exists to be ground into flour. Magic being solely controlled through skills instead of equipment means that there's not as much reason to hang on to things. It's fun to progress, more fun than Starbound was, though it suffers from some of  the same issues.

Currently below a point in the map things cease spawning. If they, instead, had ore from the next tier and more gold and silver, with next tier enemies but current tier loot chests (if they did enhance chest loot one tier) then it would be more reasonable to delve deeply and greedily.

There aren't like, old ruins you find below ground, so the underground is possibly the least enjoyable to explore. Between underwhelming chest loot and few if any ore veins between open spaces it's typically best to run from place to place in caves and only cut small pieces out between them.

You end up with a bunch of zones, most of which are pretty useless to you. It's like Starbound in that regard, but even Starbound had gold and silver spread throughout. Gold lacks recipes, which is weird. Gold and silver are never used as ornamentation for armor recipes. A comprehensive balance pass could fix all of this. I hope this game does well, because it's still a high point in the genre for games not named Terraria. I'd love to see this developer be able to afford to release quality patches for some time to come.

Edited, original review follows:

This game HEAVILY apes Terraria, but that's not a bad thing per se. I've played most or all of the Terraria clones I am aware of but so many felt the need to do their own thing to some degree. Crea's research mechanics, Starbound's expanded tech trees and plot based progression, Necesse's town management automation and largely pointless map exploration, Core Keeper's boss based progression (admittedly Starbound flirted with this early on.) and multi layered quasi 3d.

RoM has a map like Necesse, but gives you reason to use it. It has quest based story based chapter progression from what I've seen. It's going more for e.g. "High HP/damage regular monster" for the first chapter but I imagine larger bosses are down the road for me. The equipment is more varied than Terraria and there are RPG mechanics as well so there's a lot to do.

I've got a feeling that this may be less fun multiplayer, the maps are fairly small, so there won't be huge boss  arenas for the player to build, but they also ban building blocks in dungeons or combat focused areas. This may be seen as necessary for balance, but trying stupid exploits is organic fun gameplay in a way. It's hard to say that a boss is bad IMO if no one plays it as intended, but I don't think the answer is removing the cheese entirely. I'm sure if there need to be large boss arenas they will be provided  for the player.

The combat is more character skill focused than item oriented from what I have seen, but there probably should be sales of items above your current tier. It's far more silly to limit shops than organic spawning, if there were safer places with no iron that doesn't mean people wouldn't sell better equipment at extortionate rates. That's just IMO, they should sell higher tier gear.

Instead they go all in on xp based progression, get level 15 and you can make all the copper gear, but it starts unlocking earlier and each piece gives near a level in xp so you have fits and starts of easy levels at least early on. You can spend your coin on training, and there are free training scrolls that give flat xp buffs. So far exploration is a little underwhelming, there are no early game balance changers like the ninja stars in Terraria can be for exploration focused players before they improve their gear.

On the one hand these limits mean you won't dive down to get ore and come back with enough to make  a full suit of gear three tiers higher than you have, or find a magic weapon that makes combat a breeze for awhile. On the other it feels like a safer investment to build  a suit of armor and tools each tier.

You can fast travel from map to map via the overworld map but you currently can do so from deep underground. I have yet to dig  a hole straight down to see if rare ores spawn on tier 1 maps for sure but I haven't seen *any* so I imagine gold and silver, even iron probably don't spawn at all in early locations. This makes the home mirror from Terraria useless but there is still a lot of neat stuff that these chests feel like they lack in RoM at this point.

So far it has it's hooks in deep, I may update this with additional impressions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016239260', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1679858924}
review:
Terraria x D&D
Moins nerveux que Terraria, mais avec de vrais élément de RPG.
Des quêtes, du leveling à la fois du perso, et de toutes les stats, avec quelques arbres de compétences pour le combat.
Au lieu d'une grande map unique, pleins de petites zones sur une carte immense, certaines libres pour farmer, et build, d'autres sont des zones de quête, des donj, des villes, où on ne peut pas build.

Un très bon jeu, mais avec un rythme assez différent mettant plus en avant le roleplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971316077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1658683963}
review:
Overally a enjoyable mix of RPG, Sandbox, and open world.
It gives a reference to the old style of 2d rpgs with upgraded goodies.

It still needs development but overall it's worth the cost and entertainment it currently provides is plenty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092457937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1693574905}
review:
In short, though crude: It's like Terraria but has more RPG experience. 

Great quality of life mechanics like autosave w/ options for time-interval, auto-dumping similar items in chest and 'connecting' workstations to chest items. Game rewards gameplay, secrets give good rewards that insentivizes player to seek them out, completionists or not.  Orc racial bonus actually applicable to all class types unlike any other rpg with orcs in it. Change difficulty at any time in the option menu, up to 15x more difficulty than normal, this is great for all folks. 'Side' professions are rewarding but not totally essential, which is great.

Small Bugs: 
-Sometimes I cant loot(interact) a corpse until I switch to harvest/builder mode tool 1 for some reason.
-Sometimes home npc partially sinks into the floor blocks.

Suggestion for devs:
(I do not mind working for any of the stated features above as long as said quests or just the features themselves are implemented)
-Implement a feature where you get to loot all + bury defeated enemies with a single button press without opening up the corpse menu.
-There should also be a 'Take all materials' feature for the animal farms and another that 'Take all materials excluding the feed'.
-Have another potions bar for builder/harvester mode that stores another 4 potions different from in combat mode's potion bar.
-Implement 'Apparels' so that we can put certain armor on Apparels to reskin our current armor.
-Allow refilling multiple empty water containers/vials by holding left click on water source instead of clicking for each. Or any way to make them refill faster, really.
-Weapon tags for each weapon for ease of build. e.g. Bloodfury's weapon head could be a short axe or hammer. Having a tag in description would help immensely.
-Allows 'Full View' of all bags. It can be in a single big window or multiple smaller ones representing each bag that can be 'attached' to the main bag window.

Adding more thoughts as I play through.

It hits right up my alley so this is a biased review tbh. 8/10 for now. If the features suggested is implemented in a way or another, it can hit a 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124643658', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1661281506}
review:
A major point I'd like to make is that the devs are very involved with fixing, tweaking and updating the game + attending to the users issues. A big plus in my opinion.
I finished a 100% main/side quests completionist run. The game's very fun, I'm not even fond of singleplayer games but this one charmed me. 
The art is enjoyable, the story is also interesting (some dialogs are quite funny, some are cringy too haha). The game itself is good overall, a very fun play (and very worth it's price).

The bad things to know:
T̶h̶e̶ ̶g̶a̶m̶e̶ ̶h̶a̶s̶ ̶a̶ ̶c̶o̶u̶p̶l̶e̶ ̶b̶u̶g̶s̶, it requires a couple tweaks (esthetically & in mecanics such as summoning and foes AI), CQC enemies are WAY too easy to fight, you just run at them and zig zag left and right on top of them and they hardly hit you, and undead summons aren't practical they're rather frustrating.

I̶n̶ ̶m̶y̶ ̶e̶x̶p̶e̶r̶i̶e̶n̶c̶e̶,̶ ̶I̶ ̶v̶e̶r̶y̶ ̶m̶u̶c̶h̶ ̶i̶n̶t̶e̶n̶d̶e̶d̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶1̶0̶0̶%̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶a̶c̶h̶i̶e̶v̶e̶m̶e̶n̶t̶s̶,̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶I̶ ̶g̶o̶t̶ ̶s̶l̶a̶p̶p̶e̶d̶ ̶b̶y̶ ̶a̶ ̶b̶u̶g̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶d̶i̶d̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶c̶o̶u̶n̶t̶ ̶p̶o̶w̶e̶r̶f̶u̶l̶ ̶e̶n̶e̶m̶i̶e̶s̶ ̶I̶'̶d̶ ̶s̶l̶a̶i̶n̶ ̶a̶s̶ ̶d̶e̶a̶d̶,̶ ̶I̶ ̶w̶a̶s̶ ̶a̶b̶l̶e̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶f̶i̶x̶ ̶a̶ ̶p̶a̶i̶r̶,̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶3̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶m̶ ̶a̶r̶e̶ ̶f̶i̶g̶h̶t̶s̶ ̶l̶o̶c̶k̶e̶d̶ ̶b̶e̶h̶i̶n̶d̶ ̶q̶u̶e̶s̶t̶l̶i̶n̶e̶s̶ ̶s̶o̶ ̶I̶ ̶c̶a̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶f̶i̶g̶h̶t̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶m̶ ̶a̶g̶a̶i̶n̶ ̶u̶n̶l̶e̶s̶s̶ ̶I̶ ̶g̶r̶i̶n̶d̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶a̶c̶h̶i̶e̶v̶e̶m̶e̶n̶t̶ ̶o̶n̶ ̶a̶ ̶f̶r̶e̶s̶h̶ ̶s̶a̶v̶e̶,̶ ̶s̶o̶ ̶y̶e̶a̶h̶ ̶I̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶4̶ ̶a̶c̶h̶i̶e̶v̶e̶m̶e̶n̶t̶s̶ ̶p̶e̶n̶d̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶u̶n̶t̶i̶l̶ ̶I̶ ̶g̶r̶i̶n̶d̶ ̶a̶ ̶n̶e̶w̶ ̶s̶a̶v̶e̶.̶ The devs fixed this as of 1.0.7 so I earned my achievements without starting a new save.

 And lastly, I don't know if the end-game boss fight was intended to be super simple and easy or the boss's AI requires some work / the boss got bugged... Maybe I was just too strong hahaha

Whatever text is slashed, is done so as to clarify what was updated from my review.
developer_response:
We've fixed the issue with powerful enemies in 1.0.4.

If you contact us through Discord or Steam discussions we will assist you with getting all achievements without requiring a new playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329619693', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1658741624}
review:
Приветствую смотрящих обзоры. Для начала хочу сказать, что если у вас есть на кошельке лишние 304 рубля (до 3 августа, после уже 435), то я настоятельно рекомендую вам взять эту игру. Теперь же чуть более детально

[h1] Сразу о минусах [/h1]

[b] 1. Отсутствие локализации [/b]
Серьезно, тут нет любой локализации, только английский. На удивление, для многих в наше время это решающий фактор и практически всегда воюют две стороны : "как можно не знать английский" и "я пришел в игру играть, а не сидеть с переводчиком". Ну лично для меня  язык здесь  понятный и текст я перевожу сразу же, но если у вас с этим проблема, то могу лишь посочувствовать, текста тут много, но об этом позже

[b] 2. Гринд и прокачка [/b]
Отчасти это и плюс и минус, но наверное больше минус. На каждой "квестовой" локации есть секретки и временами сильные враги. Из секреток всегда падает один и тот же лут, из сильных врагов, собсна как и из любых врагов, падает рандомный. Из секреток игроку даются : новые инструменты, новое оружие, новая броня, книги опыта и сферы знаний. Как понятно из названия, книги опыта прокачивают опыт в определенной профессии, а из сфер знаний можно создать свиток таланта, который даст дополнительно очко таланта. Чтобы собрать нужное количество сфер придется облазить почти все секретки на доступном участке карты. Да, это может быть интересно, но это может быть чертовски утомительно и лично мне было чертовски сложно достать секретку в пещере острых клыков, где нужно было запрыгнуть на карниз. Прыгнешь сильно - ударился в потолок, прыгнешь слабо - не допрыгнешь, а вот эту тонкую грань нужного прыжка было мне невыносимо достичь. Но я слишком сильно отдалился от темы, то уже проблемы секреток и моих рук, а никак не гринда и прокачки. Проблема гринда же в его затратности. Профессии в игре можно улучшать тремя путями, книгами, у мастеров за звонкую монету и самому, просто создавая разные предметы (исключая те профессии, где нужно собирать вещи ручками, например травничество или фермерство). И это долго и затратно, нужны ресурсы, а их нужно добывать. Имеешь ресурс более высокого уровня, который даст тебе больше опыта? А вот сиди с ним и добивай ресурс, который тебе доступен, чтобы потом, когда увеличишь свой навык, уже делать веревку не из джута, а из льна. Возможно, это базовая механика такого типа игр, но для меня это безусловный минус, ибо время для меня самый ценный ресурс

[b] 3. Загрузки [/b]
Что может быть минусом в загрузках? Микрофризы. Ты дерешься с противником и оп, игра решила сделать автосейв и тебя на доли секунды затормозит, кнопка не прожмется и ты погибнешь. Хочешь загрузится с автосейва и продожить бой? удачи, ты заспавнишся с "мирной" раскладкой, а не боевой и нужно будет уворачиваться и пытаться или добить врага, или схоронится в спокойное место, где уже сам игрок быстрым сохранением создаст себе точку.

[h1] Ну вроде с минусами все, теперь о плюсах [/h1]

[b] 1. Мир [/b]
Сюжетные локации очень красивые на мой взгляд, все очень гармонично и аутентично, у охотников висят трофеи, у повара котлы и столы, у торговцев ларьки и тд и тп. НО, тут очень важное но, мир за стенами не живой. Вся карта разделена на два типа локаций : сюжетные с бессмертными объектами, кроме стен для секреток и "песочница" дикого мира, где игрок может делать что захочет. В песочнице игрок не увидит как допустим волки едят кобольдов или троглодиты охотятся на крыс, для всех единственный враг это игрок. Даже если с игроком путешествует непись-торговец (вроде сломанная механика, но нужно наиграть больше, чтобы говорить об этом уверенно), то на непися не нападут, а будут охотится опять таки только за игроком (возможно неписи просто бессмертны бонусом, а умирают только во время квестов, но этого я доподлинно не знаю)

[b] 2. Диалоговая система [/b]
Когда я искал видео по этой игре, чтобы посмотреть обзоры или узнать что-то новое, то игру не один раз сравнивали с Террарией и Древними свитками. Каюсь, в свитки так и не поиграл достойно, но чутка про них знаю, а вот тераррия, ну тут лучше по порядку. Почти со всеми НПС можно поговорить, возможно это будет буквально пара фраз, но это будет пара фраз с рандомным неписем, из этих слов можно будет составить определенную картину о мире или о деревне, в которой находится игрок. Иногда могут подкинуть квестов, вроде мимоходом обучить работать со станками или попросить принести/отнести определенную вещь. И тут в отличии от некоторых  "псевдо-рпг" выбор фразы решает дальнейшие взаимоотношения игрока и непися, кто-то может и обидеться, если сказать, [spoiler]что он ничего не стоит как солдат и является посмешищем.[/spoiler] Но это уже стоит открыть себе самому. Чутка не относится к диалогам, но также влияет на них - книги. Путешествуя по миру можно найти разные книги, от дневников и поэм, до рассказов о старых богах и записок. Возможно, там будет всего одна страница, но эта страница будет написана и не будет просто текстом ради текста (ну я так надеюсь)

[h1] Суммируя [/h1]
Лично мне игра понравилась, да, она не без минусов, но для меня плюсы (хоть по цифрам их и меньше) перевешивают их. Для этой игры мало моих 10 часов, для более полного мнения нужно наиграть больше, гораздо больше

Если вдруг среди читающих найдется более знающий игрок, то комментарии и  критика приветствуются, ибо обзоры я писать абсолютно не умею

author: {'steamid': '76561197965953724', 'num_games_owned': 1245, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1677636074}
review:
Think about Skyrim, Terraria, Starbound mashed together. Professions, ability skill trees, crafting, harvesting, questing, the whole nine yards.

Pros:
- Dialogue and quest choices do result in different outcomes
- Writing isn't too bad and lore is moderately engaging
- Different playstyles can lead to very different experiences
- Crafting is intuitive and fun, nothing groundbreaking
- Pre-generated areas feel rewarding to clear
- Lots of secret chests and small jump quests!

Cons:
- Farming seems unnecessary, to mirror other reviews
- Combat and movement feel a little floaty
- Trees don't drop much wood
- Crafting guide would be helpful (x ingredient used in y recipe)
- Building your own base seems under emphasized in a game full of decoration and crafting tables

All in all, I'm having a pretty gripping time! Another crafting/platforming/RPG that I assumed would be mediocre and uninspired since so many games have given it a try, but I'm glad I picked it up. The RPG elements blend very well with the classic formula and it works very well. Hoping to see more content updates and excited to get a little deeper into the questline!

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008854307', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1659028317}
review:
I recommending getting this game on sale.

It's a fun little game that scratches the open world, survival crafting itch. The handcrafted "protected" maps are mostly good, with interesting details and optional platforming rewards. The procedural generator "sandbox" maps are... ok. It's good if you just want a random area to gather resources and have a few fights but aren't overly interesting.

The game is a bit rough around the edges. The autosave causes the game to stutter, which can be painful during platforming or fights. As others have said, there isn't much juice or effects for potions, which can feel a bit underwhelming. It's certainly a playable game, but it could use some more polish. Hopefully the indie company "Polished Games" keeps working on it and lives up to the developer name. ;)

Edit: The autosave seems to be slightly better after the update, and they seemed to clean up the Save menu slightly. Not bad. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198081111924', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1658619519}
review: Поиграл я не очень много, но что я могу выделить за это время - в игре достаточно приятная пиксельная графика, для фанатов олдскула будет в самый раз. Что приятно - здесь есть и немало дропа с врагов, и скиллы (пассивки и активки) и крафт с добычей (которые качаются от использования). Также из футажей и информации от других ребят видно, что тут контента на часов 10-20 хватает с головой (тут и квесты, и секретки и всё прочее). Это из хорошего. Из плохого - в игре ужасные анимации, когда герой наносит удар то складывается впечатление, что рука героя живёт отдельной жизнью. Аналогично и по атакам врагов - некоторые выглядят ну очень слабо. Квестов вроде и много, но большая часть (по крайней мере в начале) - на уровне квестов из ММО, отнеси-убей-скрафти и отдай. Многие проводят параллели с Террарией и Starbound, я к сожалению с ними слабо знаком, но могу однозначно сказать, что эта игра не проходняк, но очень нишевая - так что покупать стоит только если вам нравится фэнтези сеттинг, блуждание по данжам и крафт со строительством - при 100% попадании игра думаю подарит вам немало удовольствия :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970724214', 'num_games_owned': 1526, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1658610363}
review:
Could be good, but needs WAY more polish.

[b]The Good:[/b]
[b]+[/b]Decent pixel art. Somewhat plain, but good details, like equipment changing your look.
[b]+[/b]Ambitious amount of detail in races, skill tress, skills.
[b]+[/b]Dialog trees, though they could use some tuning to make them a little less dry.
[b]+[/b]Large amount to craft.
[b]+[/b]"Static" levels are fun to explore, as there's hidden chests.

[b]The Bad:[/b]
[b]-[/b]Doesn't seem to run great on my hardware (AMD 5900x/RTX 3080) on medium setting, 1440 windowed.
[b]-[/b]Not every container is lootable, but you won't know if it is or not until you get close and manually mouse over every single one. The "hidden" containers are the exception, as they have a orange/yellow particle effect until looted.
[b]-[/b]Sprint doesn't work half of the time, with or without stamina, when platforming on 1-2 tile wide platforms. This makes platforming rather tedious quickly.
[b]-[/b]Limited weapon choices—axe, sword, hammer, dagger and spear. Some spells and summons, but from what I tried they are kind of weak. No bows, and no short term plans to add them.
[b]-[/b]Game [i]claimed[/i] it was autosaving, but there are no saves to load. I lost all my progress due to this, since the game pauses every five minutes to do this I didn't bother saving on my own. Technically my bad, but what was the point of pausing gameplay every 5 minutes, including in the middle of fights?
[b]-[/b]Crafting's a bit overwhelming as there are a TON of dedicated crafting stations.
[b]-[/b]Dialog is overly verbose for what it is, and super cringey most of the time. Things are either mundane, or borderline incel. Kinda... weird. The conversation about the lady's dress was one of the earliest moments of "wtf" for me.
[b]-[/b]Basic combat is kind of easy to the point of being boring. AI isn't particularly challenging and you can usually just hop out of the hole you're in and pelt stuff at range.
[b]-[/b]Everything is some variation of a fetch/kill quest. I'm only in the second town and losing interest in crafting tin axes.
[b]-[/b]Can't mitigate janky feel of controls by rebinding them. Apparently, adding this in the future isn't possible according to developer.
[b]-[/b]No co-op.
[b]-[/b]Lack of feedback when using potions. No noise/effect at all on the character, just the buff icon (thought the health potion will pop out small heal numbers).
[b]-[/b]Lots of randomly generated loot with little variations in stats that are a bit annoying to sort through, as there's no quick visual way to check if it's better than what you have (green/red color coding on the stats of previewed items, for example)
[b]-[/b]Game economy seems weird, with things like tin armor being better than the town guard's armor in stats, but costing less. Not sure if this is throughout the whole thing, but it was pretty noticeable starting out.

As I said—this could be good, and the fundamental idea is interesting (Terraria/DnD hybrid), but it just needs way more work before I can recommend it. I normally can't help myself from playing these sort of games, but it's just not clicking for me this time around. I hope they keep working at it—I plan to check it out again in the near future once some updates come through the pipeline.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985764036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1659176703}
review:
Is this Terraria? Kind of. Is this Starbound? Kind of. 

Realms of Magic touches upon the same type of game-play that these other two highly successful titles have. Albeit, a little differently. In Realms of Magic, you will craft your work tables, pick talents in a skill tree that will determine your (combat)  play-style, and proceed through a mix of handcrafted and procedually generated maps. While not original in design, I am having a fun time with this game. For the price tag, this game is worth giving a shot. The game is currently still being tweaked quite a bit and the developers are very active in their discord.  As of writing this review, they are still taking suggestions on possible future features and respond to any bugs found in it's current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967252453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1709654954}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032359633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 10967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1912, 'last_played': 1689814523}
review:
Similar to Starbound with a story and a world that feels like it's grounded. 

Villages are pre built and not generated, meaning people have names and have existing backstories. Backstories that build the character of the towns. Quests in cases relate to these backstories even if it's something as simple as recovering clothing from a one night stand. Not every quest is to save the world.

The best bit? You don't have to do a single quest, you can unlock the next area with map fragments found in random places in the zone via enemy drop/chests. Quests are 100% optional and a few of them have multiple choices. Non violence is an option in some cases.

- Everything you do nets you exp towards level ups, crafting/gathering included. Crafting is complex enough without being tedious. You can grind out crafting levels and become stronger via the experience that is applied to your main class. So doing every profession, if you desired to, would reward you with level ups and talent points. Mining is an example of this, so literally nothing is a waste of time even if that skill isn't something you care about.

- Talent trees are fairly complex. I personally love Mace spec, Fire spec interests me and I can't wait to try it out.

- Race selection is extremely critical and they can vastly alter gameplay. Lizardmen being an example of a pure combat Race, others excel in skills by large factors and/or have unique abilities. These Race picks are not just cosmetic. Outwardly they might seem to have winners and losers but they are all extremely well balanced once you understand the mechanic. Except Gnomes which are the hard mode Race for people looking to test themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976993208', 'num_games_owned': 1431, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2241, 'last_played': 1669443279}
review:
Une bonne surprise et un excellent jeu !

 -Croisement entre Starbound mais en mode médiéval et Morrowind mais en 2D avec notamment des musiques vraiment inspirées des Elder Scrolls.
 -Un monde assez immense, quasi chaque case de la carte est visitable. Avec des donjons et compagnie, et la majorité, des zones dites sandbox, où on peut faire ce qu'on veut comme construire une ferme, mettre des coffres ou n'importe quoi d'autre.
 -Un peu comme dans Morrowind, pour les différentes professions, c'est en forgeant qu'on devient forgeron !
 -Les quêtes principales assez cool ! Le reste c'est du FedEx.
 -Un nombre hallucinant de décorations, armures et tout le bordel !
 -Des secrets partout !

Quelques défauts à noter :
 -Des combats et magies assez bof, c'est assez bourrin, comme presque tous les jeux de ce genre en 2D en fait...
 -La fête du grind, en particulier pour aller choper des minerais dans la pampa, heureusement même sous terre on peut se téléporter. Le craft est assez gourmand en ressources.
 -Pas très bien équilibré, rien que les bonus des races, y'en a qui sont fumées et qui font passer le jeu en mode easy peasy. (Les hommes lézards, pétés en combat. Les humains qui pex à fond etc...)

Un vrai jeu sandbox en 2D où on progresse comme on veut : fermier, guerrier, magicien, marchand, etc...

author: {'steamid': '76561198042024582', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1658622433}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961854038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1662387089}
review:
Game is alot of Starbound and Terraria, and has a great bit of lore. Also, story mode is quite long, as I'm 25 hours in at the time of typing this and I may have just passed the half way point.

While there aren't traditional "classes", you can build your character as you see fit. Want to be a spear user and go heavy armor and fight enemies up front? You can do that. Want to go pure Necromancer or Druid build? You can do that! Or mix it up, and be a combat caster! Swords, Axes, Fire, Ice, it's all there. Crafting is also quite rewarding, as you level (and it's needed for side quests), you can pretty much over gear the next zone by grinding your crafts out ahead of time.

Combat isn't bad. The game starts off slow, and ramps up. You go from crushing giant rats to destroying Minotaurs, Cyclops and human enemies. Boss monsters are also there to pose a challenge, and offer rewards for their defeat. Add in secrets across each landmark and you have plenty to do.

Want to build your own base? Maybe make a farm? yup, you can do that. All the tiles on the map (excluding mountain ranges) and their own random generated sandbox. where you can pluck the land dry.

If I had to give the game two negatives, it's that the AI isn't always top tier and you can manipulate them into positions where they can't fight back. The other: some of the secrets are frustrating....and I mean BEYOND aggravating to get. One jump puzzle took me a solid 30 minutes to get, and that was only after I cheesed it and used save files every time I completed a platform jump, just so I'd not have to start over from 1 mess up.

That aside, I fully recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027472876', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1658502306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110438632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 6306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1677598380}
review:
My hours in the game are a bit low so take this review with a grain of salt.

From everything I've seen so far it's a great RPG/crafter and I expect to play it for at least 25-50 hours to complete it once or twice, maybe a couple hundred hours if it holds up and get updates.

The game is spread around cells with loading transition between them, a huge number of randomly (or pre-randomly?) generated cells and dungeon cells proper, the later very interestingly disallowing crafting. 

The first impression within the tutorial was strong. The game is beautiful, the animations smooth, the mechanics are solid if a little slow overall at first (getting quickly better with the right stats and talents) while the NPCs and story are lovely.

Every weapons strike pattern feel unique and while it doesn't bring a whole lot of "new" to the table what it does, it does well. There's a ton of talents spread among 7 talents trees. While most of them are of the boring stat boost variety there are various "gamechanger" skills, spells and summon sprinkled in that make the game most fun.

My only concern is music, while my expectations are low and I'm fine with generic and sparse (or even inexistent), as long as there's a punch and originality to it, here the quality "seem" high but there's nothing hooking me. Just a small thing, I guess.

Leaving the review here, for now, might update later as needed but the game is a strong positive as-is.

Biggest pet peeve: The transition screen between maps. If a dev read this, please change the obvious placeholder to literally anything else, even a simple loading bar would help immensely :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970541127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1659056926}
review: Not the deepest and most amazing title out there, but it's been a while since I last picked up a Terrarria-alike, and the differences this has from the standard are rather nice ones; the ability to raise critters is a nice little addition, and the RPG-bits are a pleasant addition instead of merely needing to constantly dig through large areas of the map looking for rare resources.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993586414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1677858261}
review:
It's OK - deceptively linear and shallow (not necessarily a bad thing). Not much RNG, or depth in build variety despite what's shown in the trailers.
Would have loved to see stat ranges on equipment, and a deeper loot system with affixes and rarities.
 
Lots of bugs (eg: doing 1 damage to enemies until the game is restarted)

This game is fun enough (in Starbound kind of way) for $10, but I wouldn't spend any more on it.
It does provide solid instant gratification at times, so it's a yes from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988032581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1688676385}
review:
Summary of review: If your like me and you have thousands of hours in skyrim, and you haven't even beaten the game yet cause you love creating character concepts. Welp, then you as me is going to be playing this game until we get a heart attack from energy drinks.


Review:
At first glance of this game, it seems a bit boring, 2d Texture, the combat looks pretty repetitive.
I bought it and thought what the hell, ill try.
And oh boy was i happy to have been wrong on my first glance of this game. The 2d Texture, not the best, but the combat, the story, and the feeling of freedom while playing this game, is insanely satisfying.

I fist got blown away when i saw the character creation screen. There was several races? Many races to choose from actually, and all of them having different bonuses and different play-styles. For example the dwarf is sturdy, takes less damage and gains more exp from mining, which means he will expertly excel in building him tanky and focusing on mining, smelting and blacksmithing. While the orc for example has a berserker ability, meaning that every time he attacks he gets bonuses to damage, health etc. so him you want to build full on murder hobo build close range. While the elves have big bonuses to magic and exp gain, meaning they are perfect for building an arch mage.

And of course, the gnome....... the devs created this little bugger to create a hard mode. They have negative everything, i mean everything, health, mana, stamina, even regen. the only thing they are good at, is farming.
Ive seen a few reviews mentioning this game is too easy, WELL HERES THE BLODY ANSWER!!!! they made the gnome, specifically for you people, the hardcore people! play a gnome and cry!

The perk system have a few different trees, 2 Close combat, 4 Magic and 1 generic combat.
What i've seen so far, you can combo these trees to make insane builds, like: play Dwarf + Generic combat health perks + Wild magic armor and enemy less damage perks. And you will become a walking thick plate tank. How can you do damage? take some summons from the wild magic tree. and all you need to do, is walk up to enemys, spawn some creatures and watch them trying to hit you in their futile attempts, while they are being torn limb from limb by plauge rats, boars and bunnies...... oh god the bunnies......

Story wise, pretty good, it got me to laugh a few times. you also in a lot of quest have multiple endings to them or can delve deeper into the quests lore.

The map is humongous, every tile on the world map is a place you can travel to, there you can mine, chop wood, create genocides, and all the fun that comes with. And when you return to these places, they remain the way you left them..... that was mind blowing for me, since the map is so huge, i truly didn't think they could have that.

Last words: Its a good game if you enjoy RPG's where you create your own character and future. If your a hardcore Terarria or Minecraft nerd, then you may not like this game super much. Cause this game also revolves around doing quests, and following a story line, you cant just run to the final boss, you actually have to go from town to town, learning about the World and gaining exp to level up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035439617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2688, 'last_played': 1707196710}
review:
Pretty Fun 2D hack and slash with extensive crafting mechanics if that's your thing. Starts pretty slowly but progressively builds up to a slightly challenging endgame with some "fun" surprises amongst enemy types and abilities along the way. If you don't like crafting there is enough loot and treasure to progress right up to the endgame. Only the final tier craft gear is better than the final loot tier.

Only change I would recommend is an arena mode or skill tutorial where you get to play around with skills because skill points come so slowly that you are fairly committed to your initial skill tree and have to make choices while largely blind to the  different combat abilities and how they combine and scale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214592032', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1658496387}
review:
"Uninspiring" is not the word you want describing a sandbox game with crafting, building and skills that, in theory, should inspire some creativity, curiosity, or desire to grind. Unfortunately I feel none of that with this title. Even the writing is woefully juvenile, and the world just doesn't feel alive.

There are the gameplay bones of something decent here but it just doesn't hit the mark.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033794603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1658424359}
review:
Увы, но палец вниз! Купил игру на ранней стадии чёрт знает когда. Первое впечатление весьма положительное, решил дождаться релиза. В итоге мимо: не так детально как Crea, не так захватывает как Террария, да и в целом по большей части не так. 
Открывать сундуки и мешки через стены - ну такое себе. Перемещение по глобальной карте - никакое, просто мгновенная смена картинки. Т.е. механики перемещения по миру просто нет. Сюжет судя по первому акту просто линеен как рельса. Боёвка - так себе, никаких тебе изысков махаешь и махаешь в одной плоскости. Плюсов особо не нашёл, разве что графика и цветовая гамма чем-то напомнила Командира Кина (ностальджи так сказать). Такие дела!

author: {'steamid': '76561198191046354', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 5194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2983, 'last_played': 1698709650}
review:
This is an excellent game to set aside some free time for.  You got yourself a simple Adventure with lots of dialogue from NPCs and 2 ways to progress.  You can progress by completing the storyline for each area which should unlock the next area or you can dive underground in the sandbox areas to find map pieces which can be combined and built to open the next section of the world map.  Doing the first method rewards you better, however, but takes more time.  Exploring each special area will have hidden treasure that can provide perm passive upgrades to stats in some way or offer some gear or scrolls which add xp to crafting skills.  All crafting skills and things like mining, tree chopping, etc all level up by either visiting trainers, finding scrolls, or simply performing those tasks.  With that said, game provides different ways to play the game in a way.

You got also a skill tree that lets you use magic of different elements or learn weapon skills or passives for defense/offense.  Back in early access, I actually had ignored magic altogether except a buffing spell or a heal and went for weapons/armor passives and skills and it all worked out great, but enemies were lot weaker back then too.  Even now, you can still give enemy more health and damage if you find things too easy or give them less if too hard with a few presets already in place.

It's a low budget game that still lot of fun especially if you into the storyline, but best part is you can play as a lady dwarf and that's worth thumbs up alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452641657', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1658395323}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969741894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 8930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4598, 'last_played': 1659619759}
review:
Final release version arrived, early access no longer!
All issues I reported were fixed (sometimes even in the release preview version)!

For me this was early access done right, and yes I do recommend the game if you can get along with the art and more action oriented combat with the occsional (mostly optional) plattforming for treasues and achievements.

Other interesting and in my opinion good aspects
- The game is balanced around locations / regions, there is no level scaling with the player level.
- You level up your skills by using that skill or alternatively by finding a suitable trainer and paying money
- The game has location specific handling (you can see the info on the map / travel screen in advance):
-- 1) fixed locations such as quest locations and cities in which you can not change the environment much (only some dirt here and there to find hidden items but nothing crazy) 
-- 2) sandbox locations in which you can shape and build to your liking.

I liked it enough to finish the preview version and still looked forward to start a new run on the 1.0 release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061171719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1695841750}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967433737', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1669348007}
review:
I'm 3 hours in so this is an early impression but:

+ Hits the sweet spot between sandbox RPG and crafting, like Terraria meets Skyrim?
+ The protected / free zone split is pretty cool. Let's you craft and build with no limitations in unoccupied tiles on the world map. All seem to be random.
+ Seems to have a lot of build options, I'm curious how "dual-classing" will work out because there's no way you include a Necromancer tree / melee tree and expect me NOT to build out some kind of death knight.

Really no cons so far except for a few QOL changes that could happen to a few pieces of the UI / hotkeys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143233334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 15736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2920, 'last_played': 1696343240}
review:
I really like this game. It's really chill, a game I can get lost in, building houses, farming, etc.
But there still seems to be some bugs that needs to be addressed. The shield disappearing has been present for a long time and still is. Very frustrating. Still had a lot of fun with the game but stuff like that ruins the experience somewhat.

Edit: Never mind, the bug has been addressed and seemingly fixed, so now I have enjoyed the game for several days without bugs :)
developer_response:
Disappearing shield bug is basically a meme at this point. During literally thousands of hours of testing over a dozen different machines it never happened to anyone on our team. Also no one who reported this issue was able to provide us with steps on how to reproduce it or capture the bug happening on video.

If you could provide us with steps on how to reproduce it or capture it on video, you will become a legend in Realms of Magic community.

Also, are there any other bugs you've noticed?

author: {'steamid': '76561198080487882', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1708032768}
review:
This game has more content and love than some current triple-A titles and it's never fair to compare indie games with those billion-dollar companies but you can also say that bigger companies start losing or it's just not profitable to have a common sense these dark days, the current industry it's lacking in some many fundamental aspects and once they start thinking about how many zeros are they getting and who are smarter or more creative and have the better lawyers to patent mechanics and not use them again for decades and don't even think about trying something similar because the money and they just hurt the whole community because if they're not getting money nobody will and they always want to let the world know who did it because human ego or whatever, they don't care about how to evolve gaming as a whole.
 
Those days are gone but we can try as consumers to get back by not buying or playing those games but please remember to tell them so. "Ten people who speak make more noise than ten thousand who are silent."

Some of the many mechanics this game has are not new but are essentials and should be a base of pillars even if they're not well executed but a world map where there are major conflicts between factions should be basic even if you don't care, in almost every genre in which this game can be categorized for example the dialogue menu with multiple options and the option to choose with the mouse or the keyboard it's basic and still neglected for whatever reason the big shots are giving these days, it doesn't make your end game different but it gives you great and fluent gameplay immersion, a game inside the game together with the books and every little detail each race, village, dungeon in general have and of course, the sandbox tiles are just insane.

You'll have to try it, when I saw the video/pictures I honestly didn't believe it and saw the reviews from early access and then I wanted to try it, and then it was one of those games that sucks you in for hours with some flaws from time to time but those are so little but I understand that for some people are big red flags but still you'll need to try it but please remember this is a small team doing way more than those big shots and you know who they are.
developer_response: Thank you for your kind words!

author: {'steamid': '76561198247356110', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1658425306}
review: Had to update my review since the dev helped me IN SUCH a speedy time and they knew the answer to the problem. My god dang stupid anti virus software was trying to block the game, and by unlocking it, it fixed all the problems! Wow... it makes me feel so dumb haha. I had complained about a few things that I would like to state again, that I do understand the devs answer to. I had complained that, all the races share the same start. The devs told me this is simply due to not having (Currently) enough resources to give all races there very own start. Simple answer to a simple question I am totally okay with, besides perhaps in the future this is something they can change! Also I had a few "Bugs" that I ran into but were just MY PC trying to protect itself by killing my fun haha. So no bugs. The game does have a certain feel to other games, but is deff a diff game in its own right. I will now leave my review like this and play more, since my PC was so busy killing my fun in the beginning I didnt get to do a whole lot. I will update again. THANK YOU DEVS FOR REPLYING SO FAST!
developer_response:
Looks like all of the issues you are describing boil down to one problem, which we should be able to fix. We would be grateful if you could contact us through comments here, by email to support@polishedgames.com, or through Discord.

Regarding the same start for all races - we simply don't have enough resources to make a lot of unique content for each race.

author: {'steamid': '76561199111338564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1658353515}
review:
Lost input an had to reboot after changing the resolution.
UI was too tiny for 4K
Trying to start the game would give me a black screen but I could move around without seeing anything
developer_response:
Sorry for this issue. Several people had the same issue, and one of these things always solved it:
1. Changing the fullscreen setting.
2. Changing resolution setting.
3. Changing the zoom setting.
4. If you are using multiple monitors, unplugging the second monitor worked for one person.

If one of those things solved this issue for you, please let us know, as it will help us with fixing this issue.

The interface can be increased by the GUI scale option. Looks like for some reason the game didn't set the proper default values for you. We will try to fix it as soon as possible.
