author: {'steamid': '76561198041170480', 'num_games_owned': 2490, 'num_reviews': 1220, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1657110356}
review:
[h1] Fantasy Terraria [/h1]
A strange world to explore.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2831295291

[h1] STORY [/h1]
In fact, we write the plot in this game with our actions when communicating with the NPC.

[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]
Gameplay is about exploring the world and points of interest in it.

The local world is divided into relatively large locations located at points of interest.

There are large buildings and dungeons that are teeming with dangers, monsters and treasures.

There is a progression of heroes and the study of skills.

I was pleased with the variety of races - there are as many as 9 of them. There are many options for crafting and building.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2831295178

Consider the pros and cons of the game, sum up.

[h1] PROS: [/h1]
+ Nice 2D graphics.
+ Good music and sound accompaniment.
+ Good role-playing system with races and skills.
+ Good crafting and building system.
+ Excellent beautiful locations.
+ Many kinds of enemies.

[h1] CONS: [/h1]
- Not detected.

[h1] CONCLUSIONS [/h1]
The game is very good. It has a lot of content and opportunities to explore the local world.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2831295225

[code] If you liked this review, then join the [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/da_way_games]group[/url][/b] and subscribe to the [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31771734/]curator[/url][/b]. [/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041349382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2908, 'last_played': 1702701080}
review:
TL;DR: Great game if you're a sucker for nostalgic RPGs + Sandbox games like Starbound, Terraria and the likes. Still a bit rough around the edges but has undeniable potential.

Main Pros:
- Really neat progression, with incentive for a balance between exploration, crafting, gathering and questing
- Good sense of freedom, you get to choose how slow or fast you want to progress in the map regardless of the main questline
- Gathering materials for crafting doesn't feel too grindy or too easy overall
- Great amount of content, especially for its price tag
- Diverse humor throughout the game, even with the dark tone of the main plot. Had some good laughs :)
- Excellent variety in terms of equipment, allowing for varied playstyles
- Interesting talent tree, you can customize your character itself to fit your playstyle as well

Main cons (are less important, but got into more details):
- Geography of proc-gen regions (basically every tile other than towns/dungeons/POIs) is VERY monotonous. Although the type of materials, plants and enemies change, different areas of the game play pretty much identically. More could be done to make exploring sandbox tiles of the map more exciting and refreshing once you get to a new region, even though the designed locations are quite good
- The lack of polish is clear, and the devs are aware+open about that, which is great. Some dialogues and journal entries don't quite match, bringing a bit of attrition in some quests - mainly breaking the veil of immersion
- Weapons have different effects and very practical differences, especially with talents... but FEEL quite similar due to the swing motions and lack of more tangible, visual differentiation.
- The character race system feels unfinished, outside of the creation part and stat differences it doesn't impact the kind of playstyles you could have or how NPCs react to you.
- The narrative and dialogues feel a bit childish/stereotypical. NPCs could have more depth and personal motivations

Bottom line is, this game is definitely worth its price and the time you put into it. None of those cons really get in the way of having fun while playing :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198115211759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1656287721}
review: Plenty of fun to be had, will update review with 1.0 release

author: {'steamid': '76561198103874486', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2802, 'last_played': 1655885508}
review:
It's... fine.

As far as terraria inspired games go this is middle of the pack - it's playable, but unexceptional and boring.

When/if all the bugs are dealt with (and there are a lot of those), the game will still be meh:
The sandbox areas are just boring, same pattern repeated over and over with few different resources and a few different enemy types, most of them reskins.

Some concepts and mechanics are either abandoned or just redundant, ex - notes about hidden treasure are useless since 90% of the time you can just see where they are when just running around and the last 10% you just see different material wall and break it open. Growing anything is also completely redundant since just running trough sandbox areas and collecting everything will be way faster than growing them, and you never really need that much resources.

Combat is okay, but unexceptional too - there is basically no unique equipment and not much combat skills, and since skillpoints are few, you wont max out even a few skill trees, and even if you could there is not much of a reason to since there is little synergy between them.

Idk what more to tell here, the story is fine but predictable, and i was hard pressed to read it since the text is hard to read, and with grammatical mistakes.
If i didint have a backlog of podcasts to listen to i would not have lasted more than a few hours in this game.
Also, why does this have open wold survival craft tag? It's neither open world (instanced areas, and even the map you need to unlock area by area), nor is it survival, unless survival now just means having hunger/thirst system, and here it just debuffs you, you dont even die if it runs out...

Meh/10.
developer_response: Almost all of the bugs have been fixed in the recent update. At the moment there are only several minor issues we are still working on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427491916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1658428450}
review:
I purchased while back when it was only $9.99 in development.
Dev tries to communicate with the public, but has not met deadlines.
More promises thrown but not met properly.
It's already Jun 21, but why they are still in EA as they announced it will leave EA on Jun 20th?
For now, I don't recommend to buy this game.
I'll keep an eye on this game to see whether I could update my review.
developer_response: Hey, while we had delays, June 20th was never a planned date. In the last post we've announced that we will release Full Version on on July 20th, which we did yesterday.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015850771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 10042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 158, 'playtime_at_review': 7978, 'last_played': 1711809754}
review: A balanced mix with terraria and and a role play game within a lot a thing to do. Some adjustment are still need to be done and content to be added (especialy inside the caves) but you can play hundred of hour without get bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991520042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4906, 'last_played': 1655614510}
review:
I want to like this game.  I have waited for many years to play it but its just so underwelming.  
First off the quests are terrible.  Half of them are buggy and make no sense lore wise.  They are badly written in broken english and its exhausting begging the game devs to fix it.  There are very few craftable tiles that make all your structures look and feel very cookie cutter.  they don't even have windows or window frames so it really breaks immersion for me.  There is almost no clutter animals like birds, bees butterflies or anything else that you would find out and about in the wild.  Its not realistic to only find giant rats and wolves everywhere.  The merchants never get rid of the stuff you sell them so you end up with thousands of items to scroll through looking for something specific.  The NPC's when you talk to them have endless circular dialogues with you and act as though you never picked up a quest or completed a quest from them.

Like I said, so many many problems.  Maybe in a few years this game might be able to be fixed up enough to be playable but as it stands now its a dumsterfire of disappointment.
developer_response:
Just want to update you that all quest bugs are now fixed.
Merchants now also completely reset their inventories when restocking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019709794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1655644238}
review: i didnt play even 2h and already my 10 save files are gone. What is this?
developer_response:
Game uses different saves folder depending on if you play with or without Steam opened. You probably started playing with or without Steam and later launched the game without or with respectively.

Please try running the game with and without Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139665285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 7317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7290, 'last_played': 1682507681}
review:
Les plus:
Un terraria avec l'impression d'être dans un véritable monde vivant, avec des villes des villages des gens quoi.
Des environnements sandbox où construire sa maison ou toute autre création labyrinthique et farfelue.
Une véritable impression de grandeur des bâtiments, les parallax en arrière plan sont vraiment bien foutus et grandioses.

Une multitude de cartes (une cinquantaine) à explorer, avec pleins pleins pleins de trésors cachés. 
Les cartes à explorer sont souvent très bien foutues et très jolies.

Le jeu est très beau et très maniable (coté plateformer exigeant mais jamais injuste ou désagréable)

Un système d'artisanat sympa même si un peu simple et répétitif sur la fin (progression par tiers oblige)

Les moins:

Histoire pas terros. Nullissime au début, elle finit assez cliché mais un (petit) effort a été fait a fur et à mesure que l'on avance dans le jeu.
Les combats sont ... pas mauvais, non mais pas excellent non plus (on est a des années lumières de Terraria par ex).
Combats de boss inexistants.
Les zones sandbox (celles pas faite à la main) sont pas follichonnes. Ca devient vite répétitif. Y'a pas vraiment de changements, de biomes dingues et interessants. Les sous sols sont tous rigoureusement identiques, sympa mais identiques (c'est toujours le même biome).
La progression se fait par tiers et peut être assez lourde, ne nous laisse pas vraiment libre de notre progression (comme Starbound en fait, pas de allez go jungle après 15 minutes de jeu comme sur Terraria par ex).

Conclusion: Très bon jeu au final, très beau avec une quantité de cartes faites mains impressionnantes et de très bonne qualité. Le sandbox construction est trés bien. Le sandbox exploration devient par contre très vite répétitif (cela dit les premières fois, ça fonctionne plutôt bien).

Moins bien que terraria, mieux que starbound mais moins bien que starbound+frackin universe. Après si une grosse communauté se forme et apporte plein de mods et de contenus, ça peu devenir un gros gros hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088644565', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6700, 'last_played': 1702823323}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041107398', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1655397497}
review:
Couldn't even make it an hour in, mostly due to controls, so YMMV. Reviewed on 1.0 Release Preview patch.

- Movement direction is determined by which side of your character/screen the mouse is on, not whether you're pressing A or D. If you're coming from Terraria style games (like me), this is horribly frustrating. Pushing A with the mouse to the left lets you run left, but pushing D makes you slowly walk backwards. To turn directions, you have to stop holding a movement key, stop holding the sprint key (if sprinting), move the mouse, hold the sprint button (optional), then push the other movement key. If you're sprinting in one direction, then push the opposite direction (which you'll do often in gameplay), the entire screen also vibrates rapidly while you walk backwards.

- Can't rebind Shift and left Ctrl. These seem to be hard coded/bound in the game? Even if I cleared the keybinds using Shift I still couldn't bind it.

- Music volume slider just doesn't work. Music at 0% in the tutorial and music at full blast. Sound slider does work, though.

- Combat feels (and looks) like I'm playing QWOP. Google it if you are too young to remember.

- One of the Elf race descriptions says they are great with bows. So they get bow weapons, right? Nope, they don't exist, unless they don't have a skill tree and the Steam discussions are outdated.

If you want Terraria with Skyrim/OSRS elements, this might tick all of your boxes if you can deal with the controls and are okay with melee or magic combat only. I applaud the devs for the 2D worlds mixed with the gridded open world map, though... fantastic design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166493190', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1677796517}
review:
(Early Access Review) 
If you like games like Terraria/Starbound, as well as games like Skyrim, this is a perfect fit for you! 

Fun story with lots of side quests, along with a ton of sandbox territories for building, adventuring, treasure hunting, farming, animal raising, etc. 
Combat is simple, but gradually gets harder with each region which adds a fun challenge. You can summon creatures to fight with you, use magic, pick from a range of weapons, etc. 
Villages and cities are intricate and filled with NPCs with their own personalities and storylines. Lots of merchants to find and get new goods. 
Opening new regions leads to not only more story, more sidequests, and new merchants, but also new materials for crafting and building your bases, new monsters, new animals to tame, etc. 

Would definitely recommend 8/10 (early access).

author: {'steamid': '76561198015068774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1316, 'last_played': 1651583595}
review:
So far game suffers from lack of any challange at all. 
Enemies don't do any damage, most skills are very boring, even if spent just a few points in one tree it is enough to easily kill everything.
Crafting is either for quests or for those who like to build, for the rest the items you find on adventures is enough. 
Food system is terrible - buffs are insignificant. 
Overall is seems that game as many nowdays suffers from lack of resonable balance, meaningful growth, and enjoyable progress/fight. 
It's not all bad, there are positives, but the longer I play it the more it feels tedious and boring.

review: It’s essential to start by saying this game has a great POTENTIAL, I had a good time with but at the moment has a lack of balance of what the hidden treasures (which are located on the structures around the map) give to the player along the main storyline, I was SO OP early in the game that it was just boring to continue playing cause the enemies and the bosses didn't cause considerable damage and died so easy, even the NPC's quest in the vast majority is boring and didn’t take much of my attention, it has a considerable amount of decorative objects so if your gameplay focus is construction will be an ok experience, another problem is the performance issues in one of the cities where the fps goes to 8 fps, unfortunately, this game didn’t work for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012089587', 'num_games_owned': 988, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1700762014}
review:
This game is a ton of fun, especially if you're the type to focus on lifeskills/tradeskills in MMOs. There is combat, there is a story, but the meat of the game comes from the tradeskills and how they work together. 

I really love how the map works, with each tile representing a whole persistent map that's more than big enough for a settlement or a quarry or a hidden cache for your various treasures. Especially helpful are the notes that you can leave on each tile of the map, as well as the little icons for quickly remembering which tile has your house, or which house has which animal farms, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043991382', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1663084938}
review: Ben bu oyunu yapım aşamasında ilk olarak facebook'ta keşfetmiştim. Yaşım 15 falandı 5 yıl önce keşfetmiştim. İlk keşfettiğimde gerçekten büyülenmiştim ve oyunu hemen oynamak istemiştim. Baya herifleri darlamıştım mesaj atarak ve cevap da vermişlerdi :D. Oyunu kısaca özetlemem gerekirse size, Arayüz , Tema, Sistem olarak Skyrim'e; Grafik, Mekanik olarak da ise Terraria'ya benzetebilirim. Skyrim ve Terraria mix'i olarak sunulmuş bir oyun. Oyun da tıpkı bir RPG oyunu gibi questler alıp yapıyorsunuz mükemmel bir haritası var. Cave'ler Dungeon'lar Boss'lar Maden'ler ne ararsanız var. Oyuna ufak bir map ile başlıyorsunuz ama belirli haydutları öldürerek ''Map Fragment'' topluyorsunuz bunları toplayarak haritanızı genişletiyorsunuz. Harita'da sandbox ve belirli kasabalar ve lokasyonlar var. Belirli lokasyonlar'da (Yani map'de adı olan, örneğin: Splinter Village) gibi yerlerde etrafı kazamaz, bir şeyler inşa edemezsiniz. Bu ilk başta beni çok üzmüştü Terraria gibi bir oyun olduğunu düşünüp hayal kırıklığına uğramıştım ama ardından fark ettim, harita'da sandbox diye verilen yerlerde istediğiniz her şeyi yapabiliyorsunuz. Dediğim gibi oyunun skill sistemi var crafting sistemi var ve çok detaylı. Yani oyun birebir skyrim olmuş bu konuda, Kesinlikle almanızı öneririm, uzun ömürlü ve çok keyifli bir oyun...

author: {'steamid': '76561198085018102', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3031, 'last_played': 1644449333}
review:
Relatively deep profession and talent system. Fun side-scrolling 2D build/explore/craft RPG with an interesting world map.

No multiplayer as of yet, but worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198914433820', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1644157471}
review:
I love love love this game but as it is, i can't recommend it. It has it's great points, it runs similar to terraria and lets you build like that game except there are fixed areas like towns which gives a better sense of life within the game, there are also a few talent trees which gives the player better control over their characters, there's a farming system, an animal husbandry system and tons of crafting.

Unfortunately, this game has serious memory problems and runs slow even on newer computers, you won't experience this much until you try to mine a zone, once you've explored a big portion of it, the frame drops start coming, this can be avoided until you get to a city with a dungeon under it, there the size of the dungeon and the city combines to make the game a stuttering mess, i'll change the score if it's ever fixed but as it is, i'll have to say no on the recommendation despite loving it so much

author: {'steamid': '76561198142532877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1701, 'last_played': 1671880351}
review:
类似泰拉瑞亚前期的沙盒机制+孤儿玩MMO
只有前期（不符合物理规则的沙盒建造，可以通天塔种地，空中楼阁养猪，我喜欢。），没有后期那些个自动化之类的玩意，你甚至不能把NPC请到你家，不那甚至不是你家，只是一张被你改造过的野外图
MMO是真的很MMO了，它甚至有跑环任务，和看起来非常MMO的生产职业物品，我直接梦回FF14，虽然我觉得他们是想致敬早期山口山。不过显然致敬MMO不能至少不应该让人孤儿玩MMO
它那几个生产职业的升级速度是不同步的，锻造只要每个图花一天挖空一块地就能升，种地要等它长几天才能收。不做肥沃土的话这一级作物收割的时候已经开下一级的新图了，食材不会退环境，但纺织材料会，养动物捡粪做肥沃土要成规模也很慢。。制皮要去好几块地刷材料练或者干脆找NPC花游戏币买经验，炼金喝药喝的太少没瓶子，一做药就要大量烧的或者买的瓶子，要么就一转买经验。
另外它这个跳跳乐隐藏宝箱也非常恶心，容错低，卡顿，甚至装备都会导致你跳不上去。地牢里的火把都可能成为陷阱（可能是bug），用被击硬直把你从平台上推下去，让你永远摸不到那个箱子。你甚至无法用技能或道具防止这个硬直，属于是非常古早的硬核设定了。
这个游戏越玩越卡，疑似内存泄漏。有时候你正在跟任务NPC对话，突然报错闪退。不过好在你再读档会直接到对话前，不会损失进度，短时间内也不会再闪退。
总之，我给这游戏好评，只是因为……它有产物能派上用场的 高！塔！农！场！

author: {'steamid': '76561198153840431', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2545, 'last_played': 1709081773}
review: I reviewed this game in the past with mostly praise but the main piece of criticism being the lack of multiplayer, and if I recall, the devs did indicate some interest/ plan to add it at some point. Maybe it was never set in stone, but nevertheless, this game being exclusively singleplayer is a huge miss and is realistically the largest factor when it comes to recommending this game. If you're like me you may have even seen the trailer and bought the game assuming it was multiplayer, and we disappointed when it wasn't. Also the title of the game is bad. Other than that. This game is a solid Terraria/ Skyrim hybrid. No I don't feel bad blatantly naming other titles here, because the inspiration is also quite blatant. Also I will continue to be salty about this game for no multiplayer. I actually love the concept of this game, but would use this as an excuse to use a "middle of the road" review option rather than a recommended just because it seems like the developers can't be bothered to add multiplayer even though they know that it's by far the most requested feature. These guys can make a real game one day, but this is a good pilot release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979674014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3842, 'last_played': 1697595588}
review: One of the few games I get excited for when I see that an update is available - there is just something about this game that gives a different, more gritty and dark feeling than other similar games in the genre it gets compared to - namely Terraria and Starbound. The development team has been doing a great job thus far. I look forward to the development of this game more than any others, and recommend it to those who don't mind purchasing early access games. To clarify, it is NOT abandoned, but if it were to ever be I would still feel that I got my money's worth out of it already and greatly enjoyed it - I have a vast library and I cannot say the same for many of the other early access titles I have played.

review:
Six hours flew by and I really only intended to play for a short time.
There's definitely things that chafe -- the stairs give two vertical squares if they line up with the floor, but the character takes three, and this set off all sorts of fiddling with stuff -- but I do really enjoy it. It's clearly inspired by games like Terraria and Starbound, but the overworld and RPG feeling pulls through nicely.

Hopefully this game continues to improve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015024152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1664468194}
review:
Fun, but lacking depth and difficulty. 

While I do feel like I got my monies worth playing this for 17+ hours(didn't finish it, just got bored), there's still a lot to be desired from it.

I know it's an early access game, but it's been in early access for a long time which doesn't really bode well IMO.

It's a good concept. I was hooked as soon as I saw that it was like Terraria but with quests and RPG elements. That's a great combo and if it was executed properly it would be a huge hit.

The combat is super easy. I kept waiting for enemies to be challenging. It never happened. I felt super overpowered and combat was trivial which doesn't make for exciting gameplay.

Go into this knowing that it's an unfinished game. There's some fun to be had, but it's relatively short lived.

Hopefully the devs are still working on this because it does have potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144953030', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2133, 'last_played': 1696358123}
review:
Проходил игру еще в 2021, когда игра была в раннем доступе и последняя глава была недоступна. На тот момент игра проходилась очень легко, без какого-либо челленджа. Зашёл вновь спустя 2 года, когда игра уже полноценна вышла на свет. Не изменилось почти ничего. Как и из плюсов, так и из минусов.
Из интересного отмечу профессии, систему городов, диалоги с НПС внутриигровыми, какая-то история. При этом же сама история довольно посредственная, непонятная. В начале игры показывается, какие расы с каких земель, но внутри игры это не имеет никакого смысла, ты появляешься всегда у людей, непонятно как.
Минусы - боёвка. Очень скучная, не интересная, легко багается. Почти все мобы ведут себя одинаково, не представляя реальной угрозы или какого-то подобия боя. А ведь игра на этом строится. Однотипные задания, мало какие являются чем-то интересным. В основном: сбегай, принеси, убей - скукота. Секреты на уровнях - крайне скучные и предсказуемые, да и ещё снабжают всем необходимым, по итогу нет смысла такового качать профессии - всё найдешь с сундуков или боссов. Таланты - идея крутая, реализация посредственная.
Брать или нет, решать в конце концов вам. На одно прохождение - пойдёт, возможно. Но до террарии, старбаунда ещё как до Марса пешком.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802528444', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 9358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1681313645}
review:
Realms of Magic is exactly what I was looking for. Yes, it has similar graphics to Terraria/Starbound, however RoM is for sure it's own game. I spent 6 hours straight playing last night, I AM HOOKED!
The game has RPG elements to it which sets it aside from other games like it, such as Terraria. You can:

- Choose between the many classes and races to play as
- Complete quests 
- Build massive bases 
- Hunt for loot scattered throughout the world
- Take down enemies
- Acquire armor/weapons from the world or craft them yourself
- Explore caves and villages where tons of NPCs reside and much more!

9/10- Check out Realms of Magic and set out on your own adventure. I'm sure if youre into action RPGs but also games like Terraria/Starbound, then you will love Realms of Magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040786919', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 28680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1668866606}
review:
SO i have played this game for over 20 hours so I think its time for a review.
My experience in this game is really positive with very little negative. 

Graphics: Pretty sharp for a game of this style. you can really see the cosmetic changes with your character when you equip new gear and every item is distinct. Its quite easy to find what you are looking for without having to mouse over things. Thats about all i got on that. 10/10 for the game engine used. 

Controls:  This is kind of complicated for someone who rarely plays 2d games. Mouse placement controls the direction your character is looking and where s/he attacks. It took some getting used to but after about an hour playing it became second nature while playing.
Right clicking equips items and there is a glorious "Sort bag" button. it makes finding stuff in your inventory super easy when you learn the order it puts things in. Placeables first, armor, weapons, tools, pots, food, water, loot(drops)
It took me a while to figure out how to place background blocks (right click) but i should have figured that out sooner. Its nice being able to make a layered house and farm that looks nice. I agree with the control scheme. 
interacting with the world and other NPCS is nicely summed up into one button "E"
Overall the controls are comfortable and there is plenty of utility to organize so you dont clutter up too fast.  This gets a score of 8/10 only because i want a "Sort chest" button. "Stack" is nice but i would like a sort button too. 

Sound: The music tracks and sound effects are top notch. Great music for each area and also while mining. It is lovely atmosphere for the game I am very pleased with it. 8/10 (i'm not a music guy)

Gameplay: Progression in this game is whatever you want it to be. You can either quest and fight things to unlock new areas or you can completely avoid the towns and just gather materials fight monsters and craft your way to new areas. If you find and assemble map pieces you can move on to the next zone before you do any story. This game is entirely sandbox and exactly what you make it. 10/10 for true freedom of progression. 

Crafting: The crafting in this game is DEEP. there are an absurd amount of craftables, placeables, food, and equipment. You have to level tanning to craft heavy armor and you have to farm or gather crops to level your weaving to level up tailoring. crafts are dependent on other crafts and its nice to have to work on many things to accomplish a craft goal you have. Also if you have a chest or storage container relatively close to the crafting station you can pull from the chest to craft. You do not need materials on your person. Great addition to such a complex crafting system.  10/10 for the crafting system.

Combat: Combat is "Okay" If your good at backing up and moving forward you can pretty much handle anything. You can be cheap in any non protected area and trap monsters inside a box and just shoot them with magic at your leisure. I guess there is no way around that in such a free game but the dungeons you get to explore that are protected are still a pretty good challenge if you do them at the correct level. Overall i give it a 7/10 when you dont cheat the games mechanics. 

Quests: Quests are like every other rpg ever but its hard to make novel quest lines. Kill this gather that. There are some quests where you have the option to not be a murder hobo and still complete the quest. Overall nothing groundbreaking. One questline i have enjoyed is Kathern's quests. Shes a farmer who will grow crops for you if you get her the seeds and will always keep them planted and restocked for you to collect as you need Pretty great long term reward for a fetch quest in my opinion. 6/10

TL;DR

Graphics: 10/10
Controls:  8/10
Sound: 8/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Crafting: 10/10
combat: 7/10
Quests: 6/10
Total average: 8.4/10 for my rating. This game is worth the price its listed for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041981125', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1710110631}
review: Full Review pending. All I know for these 17 hours of play is it has fun little quests that include crafting certain things like chains and candlesticks for people among other things like collecting pelts or killing certain beasts/people, a great balanced system for combat that gradually increases in difficulty, crafting skills(including farming, leatherworking, smithing, alchemy, cooking, tailoring, milling), multiple races, and choose your own skills as far as classes goes. Though it's still skill trees, so you can't be all the classes and it's better to pick one. Plus it has enough customization that you can stick with one. It has a LOT of sandbox zones separate from core game towns and quest locations. These sandbox locations you can mine in, cut down trees in, raise rabbits or chickens in, craft your house/fortress in, anything you want. I do love that system. Overall my first impressions are: it's an insanely good game and I'm super glad I got it when I did in early access. The team behind it has come a long way with it and seemed to have added things that increase the fun of the game, rather than junk it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992733052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 1934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1626012814}
review:
Realms of Magic est un jeu de rôle d’aventure et d’exploration en 2D vue de côté, un peu comme Terraria ou Starbound ou Signs of Life dans la présentation, mais plus proche d’un Morrowind (The Elder Scrolls) dans le gameplay.

C’est pour Windows, et ça tourne bien via Proton sur les PC Linux. Les sauvegardes actuelles (juillet 2021) seront compatibles avec la version finale.

Le personnage est crée en choisissant une race qui donne des bonus/malus qui influencent légèrement le développement, sans être restrictif.
Par exemple mon perso est un gobelin, un peu plus agile et fragile (que les humains référents), et commence avec le double saut (qui se débloque optionnellement plus tard pour les autres, et donne un triple saut du coup pour le gobelin).

En utilisant les compétences, elle s’améliorent. Une fois une compétence au niveau supérieur, le personnage gagne des XP qui feront monter son niveau.
Exemple en passant de 4 à 5 en coupage de bois, le perso gagne 5XP. En passant de 76 à 77 en cuisine, le perso gagne 77XP.
Le perso gagne aussi des XP en se battant.
Une fois la barre d’XP pleine, le perso gagne un niveau, et un point de talent.
Il existe plusieurs arbres de talents, non exclusifs : spécialisation dague, lance, épée... ou encore magie de la nature, du feu, du froid... ou encore amélioration globale avec double saut, régénération de mana, consommation d’endurance, bouclier anti magie...

La carte est d’abord fermée à la première région, et il faut accomplir moult quêtes pour débloquer la région suivante, etc.
On peut ne pas faire les quêtes, et explorer pour trouver des éclats de carte, qui débloquent une fois complétées les régions associées.

La carte est divisée en cases, avec deux statuts : protégée, ou bac à sable. Le premier empêche toute modification du terrain, on ne peut pas couper les arbres, construire une cabane, etc. En générale, ces lieux sont pré-construit et sont des villes, donjons, temples, etc pour les quêtes. En bac à sable, on peut tout casser, et construire, à la Terraria.

Je recommande ? Oui bien sûr, malgré la relative linéarité de la progression (bronze, fer, acier...), au bout d’un moment c’est plutôt horizontale (plus de magie, plus de vie, plus de rapidité...) et un peu moins verticale.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HOAmaLsmNXk

review:
It's not bad but it's not good (yet?)
It seems to lack content, it hasn't really anything special except leveling up, it feels like Morrowind went 2d while it also kept its clunky gameplay, it's not bad but it could definitely be better.
It's already better than Crea but it's a bit overpriced for what it is.

?/10 - We'll see in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026987551', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9935, 'last_played': 1667418901}
review:
Il gioco ha una difficoltà abbastanza ridicola: facendo le cose con criterio si finirà per one shottare qualunque cosa sul nostro cammino.
Lo stile grafico è minimale ma carino,anche se in alcuni punti sembra quasi grezzo(cioè alcuni oggetti sono fatti bene,altre cose sembrano troppo grosse e danno quel senso di brutto).
La maggior parte delle missioni sono ripetitive: portami questo questo e questo, uccidi caio,sempronio, parla a tizio (solitamente si risolve in un lo ammazzi)
La storia è boh,niente di speciale.
Ho speso un sacco di ore su questo gioco per vedere se verso la fine si riprendeva(sapete un tutorial fatto di 3-4 capitoli è un po' lungo in ogni caso) e verso la fine diventa un pelo più difficile,rimane il fatto che spammando una skill ripetutamente si uccide tutti senza fatica,dei danni possiamo fregarcene,solo di rado mi trovo con poca vita.
La meccanica del gioco dei talenti mi aveva attirato,come anche lo stile di combattimento,bello anche che ogni pezzo di equipaggiamento ti da dei bonus in diversi campi,MA non ha senso se io one shotto gli avversari ogni volta..che sfida è? che gioco è?
Altra cosa importante sulle quest: inizialmente dicono i nomi dei personaggi a cui andare a parlare o riferire o riportare le cose,dopo un certo capitolo no, e la qual cosa è maledettamente fastidiosa poichè le città cominciano a diventare enormi,prendendo anche 2 caselle(la odio quella maledetta città) e ovviamente non ti dice più i nomi del personaggio da cui tornare  o dov'è situato,non c'è nemmeno una freccia che indica dove devi andare,nulla..cioè se io mollo il gioco qualche giorno e poi torno a giocare,finita una quest se non ricordo da chi devo andare o dove sono impossibilitato a finirla..beh fantastico.
Dimenticavo: gli achievement di steam praticamente non li prende,ne avrei diversi che ho completato ma si rifiuta di darmeli,il che spiega perchè molti hanno uno 0%

IN DEFINITIVA

Dal mio punto di vista non ha senso creare un gioco con un'ambientazione,un contorno,un sistema di combattimento e tutto il resto se poi le cose BASE come la difficoltà e le missioni sono incasinate o difficili da seguire.

review: Weird decision to change the map mechanics. Made the game far more linear, and lost my recommendation. This game is incredibly high potential with only moderate resolution. But I do mind all of it together. This game has been out on Steam for a while now. C'mon.

author: {'steamid': '76561199050960536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2196, 'last_played': 1649045334}
review:
Fun DnD-esque take on 2D world builders like Terraria and Starbound, progressive upgrades, secrets to discover, endless nodes of Sandbox maps to make countless bases and other creations on. Could use more Skill Trees, but I do like the ones already present in the game, and build mostly Necromancer summons on my first character build.
Unfortunately, I stopped playing for about a week; Came back, save file was nowhere to be found afterwards. Wanted to get every achievement but fearing this may happen again and currently playing other games to avoid the frustration of trying and failing.
Would probably be fun with mod support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117773233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1672977289}
review:
Jogo maneiro potencial fudido. agora, precisa colocar as prioridades no lugar. realmente precisa dar muito mais enfase pra aspectos que estão ignorados durante o desenvolvimento. um jogo que é 95% funcional, mas que está somente na casca em vários lugares. combate deixa a desejar, mas vale a pena comprar e torcer pro Dev continuar melhorando ele :)

ENG: Nice game, with BIG potential. but it needs to get its priority straight. it needs more focus on some parts of it wich are completely ignored yet. its a mostly functional game, smt like 95% of what it has is working alright, but in another perspective, it has some parts and features more like a shell than anything else.. it could have a better combate overall with better AI or smt, but its worth the price, lets just hope the DEV keeps working on it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032351654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1618082692}
review:
To preface: this seems like a game with a strong basis that could potentially make something of itself someday, as it feels like Starbound mixed with Stoneshard with all difficulty removed. That being said, there's a ton of room for improvement, and I recommend keeping this game on your followed list to keep an eye on it rather than buy it currently. Some things that stood out to me were: the combat is nothing to write home about, enemies will never surprise you with how they attack and rarely does getting hit by enemies ever feel dangerous; currently many early game items (items belong to tiers based on area you find them) seem to be mid-transition by the devs to and from different tiers, so you'll be trying to find items you simply don't have access to yet; the writing is actually bad.

The last one I think deserves some real expansion. I don't know if the devs are native English speakers, they might not be, but I would say that either way, for a game that has so much questing boiled into it, either getting volunteers to go through and fix the dialogue or even paying a professional to once over the entire thing would push the quality of the game up a massive amount. A story driven(ish) RPG with weird grammar and random spelling errors is kind of a glaring issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972779575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1645760796}
review:
[h1]What Crea should have been![/h1]

I could never get in to Terraria, I'm not a boss hunting, rare ingredient/equipment finding/hunting kind of person. Been there, done that, got way too many damn t-shirts! I wanted a game that has some depth of character progression, a larger world with renewable resources, and real freedom (no attachment to story/prophecy or end in sight unless you want there to be an end). Crea got so close to that, but resources run out in that too, and it just can't fit that large/open world I was looking for.


This game does it for me! It's still in development and a bit rough around the edges (the mouse movement feels wrong in a way, you can only mine one block at a time, no official support for Linux but proton works great as of writing this), but the idea it is executing scratches the itch I've had for a while!


The only problem I really have with it is that multiplayer isn't going to happen. It was considered for a while but then finally dropped entirely, making this a strictly single player game. That really disappoints me, bringing a couple-few friends in to this kind of world would have been great fun!


If you're looking for a game that tries to broach a "fantasy life" concept, this game would be the closest I've seen on PC that is done well! I can't wait to see where this game will be at after early access!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062609598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 2561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1879, 'last_played': 1617854613}
review:
I don't want to crap all over an unfinished game, when the devs have seen this review I will change it to positive.  This game isn't fun.  Lots of tedium, lots of fetch quests, lots of crafting skill grinding.  You have to get cornbread for some gnomes? You need 50 cooking skill to make cornbread.  Better do a butt-ton of farming/scavenging to get enough ingredients to get your skill level that high.  Also the plot is kinda lame, I can't kill certain bad guys, I have to kill the elves and can't make peace. This game looks like starbound or terraria, but it is very linear.  Also several items that you grind for are completely worthless.  Like the maps of splinterville (the maps would let you unlock a region early but that isn't clear from the description and the regions unlock fast enough that you never need them). There are also severe balance issues.  Translation errors abound.  You can cheese every enemy in the game with ice spike.  On the positive side the tile sets and art assets are great, the music is good.

Things that need to be fixed:
-Game breaking glitch, Can't turn in quest to hand orc's crystals back over to Orwell.  If this is the end of the finished part of the game, You're a jerk for not putting a notification there.  Given that you can't assemble the map to get beyond, it kinda looks like that is the case.
-Tilled soil reverts to regular soil.  This only adds tedium to the game as you have to constantly switch back to the hoe while planting.  
-Only 1 tier 1 hoe.  Let me till faster or more than one tile at a time, tilling soil is one of the slowest areas of the game.
-Generic crafting XP is awful.  It takes a boatload of wood and time and doesn't go anywhere.
-Fertile soil is way too expensive at 20 poop per tile.  So you finally get husbandry set up, create a massive farm to feed your animals and you can create maybe 10 tiles of fertile soil a week.
-Chopping trees takes too much time, not the chopping but waiting for it to fall. Even late game when you one hit the trees, you still have to hang around while they turn into logs. You can't just run and chop, it is run chop pause repeat. 
-Vendors don't sell enough items.  The vendors in the largest city had mostly empty inventories.  Have them sell building supplies, raw materials, dirt, etc.  
-Drinking potions should produce glass vials.
-Filling glass vials with water is super tedious because you have to click once per vial (given that you need hundreds if not thousands to level alchemy this is unacceptable).  Let me hold down the button to fill them all or fill them faster.
-Enemies aren't challenging at all,  it wasn't until the very end of the game that I started noticing damage being done and it was all mitigated by a lesser healing potion. Except for undead sheep, they do a glitchy amount of damage when they spawn on top of you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162471000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1618076361}
review:
It will be a longer comment for those who do not know whether it is worth buying:
Disclaimer: The game is fresh, it will probably change a lot.

The soundtrack for sure on +.
Quests? It depends. Most of it is "bring, take out, sweep, kill those rats from the basement. Oh! And bring me 20 wolf fur by the way", but a few are really cool, especialy main story line.
I would like to add that after completing a short tutorial, some of the quests still look like a typical how-to-do that is supposed to teach us the things that we learned 4 hours ago (example: in act 3 they teach us how to grind flour ... come on).
As for pixelart, the graphics look cool. The locations have a lot of detail.
The gameplay is simple, a bit overwhelming with the routine and the number of items, which differ only in the "biome tier", fortunately managing the inventory is made easier by a lot of slots. 
Skill trees terribly shallow. Some gamechangers are missing. 1/4 of trees are skills, the rest are just some flat synergies like "10% damage", "bigger aoe" or "HP for minions".
I played tank / necro myself. No challenge, just summon an army and
do some melee after using all your mana, and if your opponent is stronger, drink a few mana potions and make an even bigger army. Too ez. 
And the economy. Trading doesn't make much sense. Already in the first act, after getting the basic equipment and several levels, it is enough to enter the first sandbox chunk, dig down and after 10 minutes we will find gold ore, which give us money enaught to end of act 3. Not only that, we can hardly buy anything that would be useful. Lack of rare "chase" shop items or some exotic ingrediences to spend money on. 
Most of the things we have to create ourselves, which is not supposed to be bad, but the raw materials we farm running from left to right on the first biome. 10 minutes of running, 10 minutes of metal digging and a few side locations are all we need to max out in a given act. A bit shallow. Repeat every act.
In fact, we can use any crafting table and rob the entire city (most of it is crap). Nobody reacts. When we combine this with the fact that resources literally lie on the ground outside the city, building any base is pointless, and it spoils the immersion a bit. We run from the village to the village and hear what bad times have come and what kind of people are not poor, and we collect the winter supply of onions and carrots in 2 minutes.
As for me, this is the main problem at the moment. Let's give access to all workbenches so that the player can get to know the game mechanics, but only in act 1, let it only work for low-level gear. And let it be difficult to find some resources in the wild.
Despite these few drawbacks, the locations are made quite nice, most of them have hidden collectibles, interesting loot and they look really good. Each of them has some unique theme, sutch as cemetary, wolfs den, necro cave or abbadoned village with wandering bandids. Basic stuff, but works realy well. Visiting them is a lot of fun. The exploring is simply addictive.
For me it is 7/10. A fun game to play at once, maybe back after few patches. Easy to exploit, I would even say it's too easy, but it makes up for in the atmosphere.
If they introduced multiplayer it would be wonderful. Such a second terrarium on steroids. (I had to write it: D)
If you spare some bucks give it a try, it is worth if there is a promotion.
If you buy it, please kick some pesky cobbolds asses in my name <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198057031910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1638597879}
review:
I like the digging and while I rarely like crafting in games I think it serves as a good hook for this game's sandbox game play and trying to make the next set of equipment kept me playing.

Last time I played I didn't care for the combat. I feel like there is little feedback when hitting an enemy or blocking an attack and some enemies like boars are just very annoying to fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041951307', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 3957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1663015055}
review: I loved the combat, the story, the plot and the grind, but it breaks my heart to see the game freezing my computer due to autosaves, freezes on startup, or freezes during reloads. I need to wait until the game is stable enough to play, but this is one game I definitely want to keep installed, so I can finally come back to it and beat the game without these freezes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052350575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1617499845}
review:
If you liked Starbound you will like this.

Comparisons aside it is unique in it's approach to 2-D indie sandboxes in that you are progressing through an rpg proper, fit with quests, readable lore with some of it hinting toward locations and my favorite: The Skill Trees. There are 4 trees for magic and 3 for Combat, allowing you to build a fully unique character.

I played it for a few hours, learned necromancy, struggled to keep my undead friends alive then saw them grow in power to the point I need no weapon. 

Very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109028254', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 5379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3866, 'last_played': 1677794858}
review:
Если серьёзно углубляться в механику игры, то она очень сильно отличается от Старбача и Тёрки.
Это игруха, в которой надо выбрать 1 из 7 (или 8) классов, который потом ещё и надо качать при помощи древа навыков, которое тут сделано просто, и со вкусом.
Причина по которой ты её не купишь, может крыться в том, что тут нету русского языка.
Если ты знаешь Енглисх Ленгуаге хотя бы базово, то в общем и целом понять что от тебя хотят неписи понять можно.
Игруха стоит своих денег, разрабы постоянно что-то добавляют и обновляют её.
Советую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026511921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1679475069}
review:
Gem of a game, recommend to anyone who likes RPGs with lots of stats crafting and digging through pixelated enemies with sword and terrain with your shovel or pick.

Art style is reminiscent of S Bound, but without unpaid child labour.

Already a good amount of depth in terms of races, and skill trees creating whatever archetype your replayable heart desires.

Polished Games continues to polish and respond to any reported jank, very reactive to the community.  Much appreciation.

review:
It's fun! Like others have said, it's a bit like Terraria or Minecraft, but with a lot more RPG elements.

The map and item variety are pretty limited, and there's a lot of spelling and grammar mistakes in the dialogue that kind of stand out. But overall, it's a really good game. Looking forward to future improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061900426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2689, 'last_played': 1623424895}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981131485', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1705, 'last_played': 1613519476}
review:
At first glance, you probably think this game is some Terraria rip off, but you couldn't be further from the truth.
Terraria HEAVILY focuses on finding rare things, mining, crafting and fighting difficult bosses, this game, however, focuses on a greater world, towns, story, questing, rpg mechanics and skill trees.
As someone who likes similiar games like Terraria and Starbound, I can tell you my honest opinion on this game.

The good:
+ Quests
You don't get many "choices that matter" but you do get a lot of quests overall. 
The quests will tell you vastly different stories, but shamefully many of them are repetitive where most quests usually make you go to an area and kill all the enemies, or gather certain items for an NPC.

+ World-building
Each biome and town is different, with greatly varying people & motives.
As for the different biomes, they're lacking interesting enemy/animal types and underground variety that would make them stand out more. Also, this game has no water (yet?), which is a disappointment

+ RPG mechanics
I want to compare it to Runescape, and I can tell the devs clearly took inspiration from it, but I wish they did it  with more intent. As the game is right now, you only level profession/crafting skills, and your character's level. 
As for the combat skills, when you get character levels, you will get a talent point to spend on any different skill tree of your choosing. 
You can level your character through everything, be it quests, mining, crafting etc, and you can even get talent points by collecting certain materials. (Found from specific enemies or when finding secrets)
Practically everything will build towards your characters level, which sort of ruins it a little because it's extremely easy to over-level yourself just by mining and crafting, quckly turning the combat too easy.

+ Music
There's not a lot of it, but all of it is pretty good.
Sometimes it reminds me of "Fable" but that might be stretching it.

The bad:
- Effects
The particle/skill effects look very out of place and extremely simple, 
I think it would fit more with the aesthetic of the game if they were pixel sprites. 

- Combat
As I mentioned earlier, the combat is way too easy and simple, especially if you want to take your time and do everything before you progress to the next zones. Doing this will very easily over-level you and remove all difficulty.
So far, in my 28 hours of playing this game (at this time) I have not faced a single enemy, trap, boss or quest that got me killed, mostly that's because I've always been over-leveled, but also because most enemies and hazards just don't hurt you at all. I'm currently playing a Fire mage with 90% cloth armor on and even that protects me so well that I've NEVER used a single health potion. At worst, the enemies are so weak that I don't even need to avoid them, at best, they'll take 1/8th of my HP but they die in 2 seconds without me even having to be anywhere near them.
If you specialize in to a tanky warrior build and take heavy armor, some of the armor pieces will grant you massive health regeneration stats that can make you invincible even if you stood still in front of a flamethrower trap or a cyclops smashing you with all it's might. It's absurd.

- Leveling
Currently, you level up your character and gain talent points, and with talent points, you can learn anything without a teacher. Essentially, you could play as a warrior for the entire time, and then suddenly just spend all your talent points on a magic skill tree and instantly become a wizard with no build up or learning - many games do this, but in this case I would wish it to be more fitting to the old-school-RPG style like Elder Scrolls games or Runescape that this game takes inspiration from.

- Artstyle
It has decent attention to detail in many things but it doesn't stand out or look unique compared to other similiar graphics 2D mining/crafting games.
At the moment, I like the more darker visuals it has, but that's about it, as far as the actual art goes, I think Starbound has most games of this genre beat, even if it fails in many other fields.

Overall, I would rate this game 7/10 at it's current stage in development (This was written on 17th of February, 2021)
I'm being overly critical, but that's only because I like what it has so far and I wish to see it get better.
It is an early access game, so anything could happen.
I do recommend the game, but regardless I wouldn't recommend buying it just yet unless you REALLY want to play it before it's finished.
I've seen too many early access games just stop updating, which is incredibly disappointing and rude towards all fans and customers.
Let's hope this one delivers, eh?

author: {'steamid': '76561198018457424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2113, 'last_played': 1613196764}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984830713', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1612998524}
review:
It seems... fine. Once you get your first set of armor you can basically sit in front of mobs and face tank any fight. In that way, the game is really, really easy, and considering how important combat is to the game, its pretty lackluster. When I say lackluster, what I mean is that its both pretty sluggish, and it doesn't have a ton of interesting mechanics. Mostly its laboriously swinging your weapon around while moving in&out of the enemies slow weapon attacks, and then for magic you have summons, passive aura/shields/buffs, and damaging spells that either shoot a missile of some kind, or damage a small aoe.

The game also suffers from a lot of item bloat. there are *so many items*, and its not clear why I give a crap about most of them. I have like 6 different kinds of vegetables in my inventory, but no recipes to use them, I have two different kinds of wood, two different kinds of planks, multiple fabrics, monster body parts, and just generally too much stuff to actually know what to do with any of it.

I feel like the game is close to being good, and it might get good at higher levels. I'm not sure I have the patience to get to higher levels though.
developer_response:
I'm sorry the game didn't meet your expectations.

We are heavily working on balancing combat, there will be some major improvements soon. We are also planning on improving inventory management a bit.

We hope you will give the game another chance after we've implemented those changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561199004519682', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1613007657}
review:
So... I've played this game for under an hour and it has crashed three times (Unreal 4 engine has crashed, blah, blah blah). Crashed at character creation. Fine, whatever. Sent report and restarted. Crashed in first five minutes of tutorial (Unreal engine 4 has crashed....). Sent report, lowered all graphics settings, restart. Completed tutorial (Hooray!), opened world map, selected my first location to travel to, loading screen for 15 minutes then what? If you guessed Unreal Engine 4 crashed again you'd be correct. Sent report and closed.

 For a low-end game that has been in development for over 5 years, this is beyond unacceptable. Now it's coming out of EA. Really? What's here is barely polished, poorly optimized, and controls badly. Great concept with lack luster execution. I'll hold onto it and hope the official release is better (I can't believe they're increasing the price for a game that feels like it's still in EA after half of a decade) but I'm not holding my breath. My advice, go ahead and give it a shot if you have money to burn or it's on sale for under $10 USD. I can't recommend it at this time but my review may change in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031425275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1885, 'last_played': 1612971417}
review:
First, Let me get something straight. I think this game is great. It has a lot of potential. i loved the main story. Bunch of side quests to do. However, i think the combat system is a bit lacking. Not once did I feel any challenge while fighting. Also, I think the crafting could expanded a bit to reflect the level progression. Some professions you will end up "spamming" a craft just to get enough level to proceed to the next tier of crafting.
All in all, i would not recommend the game right now if you plan investing more than 20 hours but definitely keep an eye for when they release more content
developer_response:
Hey, we are aware of the issues with lack of difficulty and it's something that will definitely be improved before 1.0 release. We are working on improving our balance tools and will be soon doing complete rebalance of progression curve, both for combat and professions.

Hope you will give the game another chance once the balance and difficulty are fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045456753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1971, 'last_played': 1698921928}
review: underrated

author: {'steamid': '76561198004132377', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2400, 'last_played': 1704644439}
review:
I am enjoying this game immensely.
I had it on my wishlist for a couple of years but held back from purchasing due to previous reviews regarding the early access bugs and gameplay.
I saw that a large update occurred last December and reviews had improved so along with the Steam 30% discount I jumped into game a few days ago.
I have had 40 hours of RPG infused Terraria styled gameplay. My OCD levels have been thoroughly put to the test with the base building elements and the progression levelling of the crafting system is enjoyably addictive.
This game reminds me more of a lesser known game called Planet Centauri and I really like that game as well.
Regarding the various negative reviews on here the reader must acknowledge the date of said review as since I have been playing this week February 2021 I have found nothing to back up the majority of former negative reviews and make the assumption that the devs have utilised the open access period to great effect and have clearly listened to the feedback from players.
The quests may be boring to some but they are often a way to kickstart or promote the players professions.
The 'hidden' secrets in each quested locations range from the damn obvious to the 'hidden in plain sight' and several of them will leave the player feeling really satisfied when they finally work out how to get to them. I am so pleased there is not yet a guide to spoil these.

I have not discovered any bugs yet and certainly not anything gamebreaking.
However 1 item of armour (Cave Dweller Helmet) and a melee weapon (Infernal Kobold Dagger) did drop from a mob very,very early in game and are far too OP to be used by such a low level and with no level requirements for items ingame these negated all same slot player crafted items for at least the next 25 levels. 

The autosave can create a slight judder when it kicks in and the timer for autosave can be set to whatever you wish.
Yes death is permanent so nurture that autosave feature.
The combat is rather clunky for melee but I am a caster type and found the mix-n-match feature of class roles a nice touch.
My fire based caster works really well with addded necro skelly summons at his beckon.
You can assign an extra 5 combat options to each of the left and right mouse buttons but only ever have 2 'active' at any moment. This is different to most games in that they let you click the selection from a hotbar but once you get used to changing the assigned actions with the mousewheel it really is not an issue and my caster summons skellies then flamethrows them to place debuffs and then fires fireballs and then resummons skellies all very quickly and easily.
Some tweaking is required to the XP generation as currently you gain character XP at level up points of professions. On lengthy crafting sessions you can gain a whole level or more of character XP at present and it does seem a bit too much.
There is no issue regarding storage of mats and armours as the vast crafting menu has so many available options for containers.
Is there anything more satisfying in this genre of games than the destruction of once stubborn blocks now disintegrating with your self crafted upgraded pickaxe? ... love it.

The discord community is a decent one and have already helped me with a building placement issue I had.
Lots of helpful advice on the Discord and no unhidden spoilers either.

Best tip I can give new players is to map the toggle for Build menu/Combat menu to the middle mouse button.
That was a game changer for me as fumbling between digging and then casting was a struggle.

TL:DR Spelunking fun with RPG infused questing, OCD driven base building, leaps of faith and spiked pits.

═════════════════════════════════════════════

           To see more of my reviews please select follow at :                      
   https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39887864-3-Month-Heroes

author: {'steamid': '76561198042668936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1692583469}
review: Great so far! I love the handcrafted levels with secrets, and the progression. As great as Terraria is, it can be a huge grind at times. Realms of Magic doesn't seem to force the player to do this. One thing I would love to see more of in the future is more abilities, (wall jumping, air dashes, double jump, crouching, etc.) and more content. What's here is great so far, and it's very worth it's humble price tag of $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985745273', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1701247998}
review: It's very much like if Terraria was melded with a more RPG-centric system. I'm really liking it, the translation is a bit off in places but for me that makes it more quirky and endearing because I imagine everyone talking with accents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057590719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1616850611}
review:
I bought this game when it was very early in early access. It looked like Terraria made by people with some serious development chops. I played it a bit, but there was not much there at the time, got bored, put it to one side, and frankly... forgot about it.

By accident, I saw the game on my Steam list, and thought 'what was that one?' - As I had nothing much to do - reinstalled and gave it another chance. Man, am I glad I did! The game as it stands now is totally transformed. As many have mentioned - this is Terraria with RPG - a match made in heaven. 
Where there was little to do - there is now a full game - quests, full crafting and a much expanded world. 

I have been waiting for something to come close to Terraria (a game I love and have played to death), this not only comes close, but (IMO) has exceeded it on many counts. The graphics are better, the gameplay is more rewarding and having some sort of story takes this sort of game to a new level. Rather than being a Terraria clone - this game stands on its own feet and has become its own unique experience.

Well done to the team, this is early access done right, and they have made a gem of a game. 

My new obsession? Looks like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054893323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7462, 'last_played': 1708387927}
review:
I am level 30 and didn't get off the first map.  Now when i try to use the map to go to a different spot it just sends me to an earlier save. I noticed a message when i logged into the game that windows defender was going to prevent some files from loading .  I guess that is what happened but i don't know how to fix it.

I did as you directed,  it restarted the game. When i first tried to use the map to go to a different section, it blinks and i end up back in the same town without having been sent to that new section.
developer_response:
Hey, looks like for some reason your system is preventing the game from saving, which causes this issue.

Could you try running the game as administrator by manually starting RealmsOfMagic-Win64-Shipping.exe located in Steam\steamapps\common\Realms of Magic\Windows64\RealmsOfMagic\Binaries\Win64. This should fix this issue.

EDIT: Did you manage to get it working? If not, could you contact me through email at support@polishedgames.com or Discord through our channel? I would love to help you with this issue.

Discord link: https://discord.gg/9nS3sMb

author: {'steamid': '76561197999219692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1655350831}
review: Without a doubt this title is VERY Terrariaesk. Though it has its own vibe and style setting it apart from so many similar games. It is still in early stages of development with promises of updates (it appears to get regular fairly big updates so far) so i'm definitely happy and intent on continuing to play and watch this titles further development. As of the writing of this review i have 7.5 hours of game time so i'm rating this as a thumbs up for any fan of similar titles, and if you can get it on a discount all the better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085587451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4199, 'last_played': 1604030713}
review:
This is a solid game for what you're paying. It's a simplistic Skyrim-esque type game when it comes to how it handles leveling up, looting, and questing. It has Minecraft/Terraria type building mechanics. While not groundbreaking (and not as deep as Terraria's), the option to have a sense of creative freedom is always nice. Though it is entirely unnecessary. There are no monsters assaulting your base, day or night. Character progression wise, there is no reason to do it. You need storage and workbenches of various types. But other than that, you can live outside without building a house at all if you wanted to. As a side note, the map is quite large. Though the scenery is quite repetitive for the most part. Especially underground. 

As of this time of writing, the game is unbalanced in several areas. Depending on your choice of gear and abilities, you can VASTLY outclass other less informed players. One-shotting pretty much everything past a certain point. I will say that I haven't tried to make a pure magic build because of how ugly the magic looks. What magic I have unlocked has not been satisfying to use. There is no sense of impact or power to it and visually it's an eyesore, to be truthful. 

I can't overstate how much this reminds me of Skyrim. It was clearly an inspiration to this game. While simplistic vs the big names, the combination of features here makes for an enjoyable experience for RPG fans.  This won't blow anyone's mind, but it has a good foundation. You're not risking a lot of money buying this either.

review:
Aufjedenfall lohnenswert, ist ne Art Terraria nur mit viel mehr RPG-Feeling.
Leveln, Questen, Craften und sich weiter ausbauen ist aufjedenfall mit drin.

review: Great game with lots of flexibility in terms of how you want to skill up. Of course this game makes me think of Terraria, just because of the ant farm sandbox style, but I also get Regions of Ruin vibes from the emphasis on different locations you can travel to on a fairly large map. Very nice variety of weapon types and just material variety in general. Strong suggested purchase, especially if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967981251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 2797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1657864394}
review:
I seem to have popped into this game right after they made a rather large update in early December. Altogether I'd say it's surprisingly solid. A pretty good mix of Terraria/minecraft/etc. and heavier RPG elements, which is something I've always felt was missing from those games.

I think this game could be pretty solid - the art style is a little hit or miss, some character faces and such just look.. ridiculous.. And some of the quests and dialog are just the usual low-quality humor nonsense that seems a good deal too common in the indie scene.

There's a bit of quirkiness with some stuff - running is kinda finnicky and you lose momentum mid-air when jumping after a sprint if you run out of stamina. 

If they add more stats/variety to armor/weapons, some special effects, secrets, spruce up things a bit in general, this could be a solid title.

I also personally love how there are actual skill ratings for crafting that unlocks stuff and how there is a MIX of procedural and non-procedural content. Dungeons and towns and such are hand-made, but any other square on the 'world map' you can visit and seems procedural, which is where you can gather materials, hunt, and build your own house or whatnot. It's more fun to me than having to constantly refer to wikis or spoilers due to simply obtuse recipes that aren't about discovery but moreso blind experimentation in a half dozen different crafting stations.

The only downside is I didn't really realize this was early access because I bought it a while back so I started to get into it a bit only to realize it's not finished and I personally prefer to play games through as I find it hard to play a while, stop, come back, and resume - much less start over. It seems pretty solid as is with good potential ahead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061979761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2052, 'last_played': 1658811804}
review:
A charming mix of Skyrim, Terraria and Minecraft. If you like any of these three games, I'd recommend giving this game a try!

The most recent update added some much needed gameplay mechanics with a cool way of unlocking each province as you go through the main storyline (which is pretty fun and dramatic at times). Despite being in early access, I've had hours of fun running around and leveling up my character.

The sound effects are as addictive as minecraft and there's a fair variety of building parts. The non sandbox zones are all beautifully designed with interesting puzzles. Not what I'd consider the most challenging if you pick the right talent points and can be a tad grindy at times when crafting resources, but really isn't too bad in either regard. Whilst the mining aspect can be time consuming for rare ores, you can run across the odd chest and stronger creature in the caves (even in sandbox zones).

I feel more guides should be made accessible, but the mechanics are mostly covered through various side missions in bite sized chunks. Definitely worth the money.
