author: {'steamid': '76561198040050874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1658351676}
review:
Is hard to review a early access game since the gameplay or play mechanics can change the game is great but something about the combat doesn't feel fun is hard to say but maybe feels slow or boring some times since after around level 20 i can't seen to be able to go full mage or summoner since i run out mana fast even after picking the mana talents since each talent only gives .5 a sec mana and +10 mana feels like a waste of points but the thing i hate most about the game is that i can only use the two skill bind to the right and left mouse but feels like a chore since the game gives you a skill bar but i can't cast spell from there since the keyboard keys only change the mouse bind spells and the reason i hate it more is because even after 20 levels in order not to die i need to always keep jumping since the pets i summon don't take most of the time the agro away from me or i run out of mana to cast spells. 

Even with all the problems that i have with the caster build i think still is the most fun since melee feels boring maybe later after picking some talents gets more good but for now feels boring i only use when i run out mana. Another thing i notice about the talent trees is that they look big but most talents are useless or is not a major change since for example the fire talent tree most talents are %10 more damage is not a big increase even after they give you %10 few more times since the base fire ball damage is 15 and even the necro talent tree feels boring since most talents early levels are about +5 secs to make the pet last longer or some health buffs. Another problem i feel the game has i haven't tested on late game maps but i seen the enemies don't respawn after i kill them i think it takes the danger level away after building a base/house in a sandbox map also the maps feel kind of small i also wish i could invite npcs so far i know i can build buildings for farm animals but i not sure about npcs i haven't seen anything not even a trader if i want to sell anything i need to go to visit the town npcs.

I recommend the game since most people will find it fun i think the game has potential after early access but i think the game still missing the Terraria fun level even if it has more RPG elements or other game play mechanics and the reason i didn't get this game before is because most game updates are Beta updates and i didn't see post about regular game updates so i wasn't sure what version of the game i was buying since in order to get into a Beta/Unstable version of the game they force you to use Discord in order to get it unlock I think they need to remove the need to use Discord or don't mix the regular update with Beta update news since it keeps potential buyers away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036600747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4398, 'last_played': 1635406734}
review:
i have had this game for quite some time now. playing it on and off i can say the developers are steadily implementing updates and some changes. their discord is great since there usually is always at least one dev around to answer questions and they listen to the community feedback.

RoM is a bit like starbound but set in a "medieval" world which i ,personally, prefer. the game has a nice variety of main quests as well as sidequests that tell the story of the game. where it differs from your games like starbound and terraria is in its leveling up which make it more like an RPG. currently the dev'S are overhauling the skilltree in an open beta which you can already play if you own the game.

you have your stable RPG skills like frost,fire,nature and necromancy on top of a nice 2 different skilltrees for melee as well as general stats.
gear matters,pieces and weapons have a variety of enchantments that will help your build without making you a total god.

the map so far is quite big with currently 4 regions available to explore. each region has different enemies,new materials for crafting,farming and cooking. so exploration is encouraged even if you just want to build. which brings me to my favorite part...building stuff :)

there is a nice variety of blocks,furniture,lightsources,clutter and so on already in the game to help you ease your creative itch. its not perfect and you will be somewhat limited in terms of making your builds unique but iam sure more is to come.

if you have played and like games like terraria or starbound i would recommend buing Realms of Magic. so far i have played 73 hrs and that was mostly just building,farming etc. iam i'll be spending alot more exploring the world,lore and just enjoying the chill building part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061728649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2067, 'last_played': 1660935032}
review: This game is honestly extremely good. Not too similar too Terraria as you have races, level up perks, NPC quests (beyond fishing and other basic tasks), The grid over-world is an amazing system for this style of game. I currently have 35.5 hours in EA and feel like i have not even done half of what is available (not even including the Beta updates that have been releasing).In short I can see 120 hours per character by the time this is finished if you like to do everything there is to do in a game. Highly recommended 14.99 USD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023581341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 7626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7348, 'last_played': 1666213966}
review:
I don't think it's abandonware yet but updates are few and scarce. Discussion board has a lot of post with 0 response. There is a bug where your shield disappear for no reason, there since 0.1 and lastly the dev said he tried and thought se solved it a couple time but now he has no hope!?! That augurs well for the future...
I am on the beta but so few has been done and major bugs persists even if some new content is being released.

You can build things but there isn't really any incentive to do so, story is inexistent yet, as stated earlier, there is quest breaking bug that won't let you advance the story. 

Else, yest you have many race to choose from but you start at the same place and you do the same shit. Everybody as the same reactions towards you (or pretty much) whatever races you are.  so it's like a big lake but a millimeter deep. 

There is potential but nothing major has happen since june I think and before that it was a few month before. 
Don't throw your cash in the toilet= don't buy this game.

I wish that steam would man up at some point and create a mandatory insurance for EA producer where, if product doesn't meet certain checkpoints, or is blatantly abandon, customer would at least get a portion of investment. 

Another theft if you ask me.
developer_response:
Hi, we would like to assure you that Realms of Magic is far from being abandoned as we are working on giving our community frequent and rather big updates. In fact, we have been continuously delivering regular updates with truly major overhauls being released every 3 months (on average, not including smaller updates and bugfixes).

The game has already changed quite a bit since the time you have written this review. We would also like to invite you to revisit the Old Kingdom and hopefully have an overall better gaming experience as we genuinely care to bring you the best product possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000925963', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1627820059}
review:
after 20 hours I'm pretty much at the end. there are some places I haven't been to, but I see no point in going there as I now have best equip I could have

that said - I don't regret a penny! I actually like that this is not another 200 hours crafting game time sink. every level, every talent point spent, every new equip,.. all those you immediately feel and they have impact. if you (like me) hate those games where you are leveling and improving equip yet do not feel any real difference, this is not that king of game. leveling and crafting of equip feels very rewarding

fighting system takes a little time to get used to, but once you do it's really nice a not unnecessarily complicated. fight are not easy, but it gets better with better equip and talents

quest are simple but fun anyway. some of them will take you around a map a little so you have a reason to look at those places. travelling on map takes no time, so it does not feel like a chore. travelling on the single map place (map is divided to many small squares and each square is single place tens of screens wide) can take some time before you get, where you want to be. but even this can get much better with right talents

besides quest there is separated guide book, which will take you through basics. eventhough it's really intuitive and you would find most things without much problems

you improve your character in two ways. first of them is by spending talents points. for each level up you get one (after those 20 hour I'm somewhere like level 58). you get experience for levellign by killing, finishing quest or crafting - that's right by crafting. I actually got most of my levels through the exps gained by crafting. each talent point can be used to gain single talent in large talent tree (that is divided in some ~8 areas). each talent spent is important and you feel the result immediately. like 1 block higher jump or +15% to attack damage

second way to improve you character is by "doing crafting". there is around 15 or 20 crafting types and each is leveled by crafting items of that type. with increasing level in that type of crafting you unclock new recipes when crafting items of that type. most types are fully unlocked somewhere around 80 crafting level. the level by itself even make crafting a little bit faster. I've smelting somewhere around level 120 at the end. each crafted item adds to a bar of it's type of crafting levelling. when new level in any crafting type is achieved you get some experience for it (for character levelling). this way you may amass even more character levels then through combat

I haven't found a single bug in those 20 hours of gameplay. actually the game feels really polished. if only half of the finished games would be only half as polished as this one, it would be great

last but not least - you can save in traditional way. what's even bere - you can choose number of saves for rotating quick saves and auto saves

author: {'steamid': '76561197961513111', 'num_games_owned': 2624, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 13504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1668731844}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987427085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3287, 'last_played': 1614456401}
review:
Totes still in development in the sense that things are constantly changing. Things are getting buffed and others nerfed so dont fall in love with any specific build just yet. but yes, BUY THIS GAME!!!

The Devs are super chill and have a discord set up where we can chat with them and suggest changes to the game and as long as you are chill and polite, they are super open and responsive. but honestly I JUST LOVE PLAYING IT!

That being said, dont come in thinking its like a Terraria clone. It's a totally different animal. Realms of Magic is a complete action adventure RPG that is build inside a 2d sandbox world. Which includes a decently sized tech tree of fighting talents that you can spend talent points in as you level up.  Its almost as if Terraria and Maple story had a sexy single player baby :P

  Ao far, I am throughly enjoying the man story as well as the quarky and interesting side quests. Ive played 54 hours and all the way through the beta twice just to check out different builds and I still havent done all the side quests... Theres ALOT of play time. The current beta up till now only had 3/7 of the quest locations and map revealed. If you guys like to craft and build an bases while you play and take advantage of crafting systems to get epic potions like me,,, Then trust me, there is ALOT of playtime already available  and alot more to come. 

Speaking of which, the new beta release with map area #4 just came out today.... Ima go hop on dat for the next 10 hours. BYEEEEEEE <3

review: A very promising game. It already has a very rich crafting system, skills system, you can mine for resources, grow plants, breed animals, build and decorate your own house any way you like it. There is already a lot of quests you can do, so you can either do any open-world shenanigans you desire, or follow the quests, up to your liking. I am really looking forward to what this will look like when finished, and I have the feeling that the creators are dedicating a lot of effort towards this goal. Thumbs up, I recommend the game even in this state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092963313', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1681294185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065014788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1679274547}
review:
Been out for less than three years as of this moment and only has 200 reviews? 

That is a damn shame, I like this game. Wish it was more seen by the public too, I'm sure some people would enjoy it.

Has questlines that one would find in an RPG.
One went like; dude wants to impress girl. Do three fetch quests and then a funny cutscene plays out and you can talk to them afterwards about what went right or wrong with the quest. It's not revolutionary, but I like it.

This game reminds me of Terraria with a focus on RPG singleplayer elements. It has hunger/thirst, but the game is super forgiving in tedious aspects while combat takes a bit of skill to time it. Made a necromancer dark elf, which meant that i had to juke the ever-living **** out of mobs while in the daylight or have a bunch of potions on hand.

TL;DR 
I hope the game continues to be updated as there's a bunch of stuff I would love to see, but I can't imagine that the passion will stay if the game doesn't take off. Depressing that there's such a low amount of reviews on it and the instant dismissal of the game simply because it looks similar to another.

author: {'steamid': '76561199053986197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1346, 'last_played': 1707426566}
review:
Amazing game. When I first saw the trailer, I figured it was just going to be another Terraria clone like Starbound. Which in itself, isn't a bad thing, but not what I was in the mood for. But after reading the top review on the game that went into all of the reasons why it's not a Terraria clone, I was sold.

 Like it said, about the only thing similar to Terraria is the house building. Otherwise, it's more of an action RPG where you gain XP specific to whatever activities you do most. Like, you level up your tree cutting by cutting down trees, mining by digging out blocks and mining ore, which is much less tedious than in other Terraria games. Even the storage system is more forgiving as you can increase the number of storage bags you can use. Which allows potentially for a couple hundred storage slots. And you're able to do so fairly early on in the game. There's a lot of flexibility in terms of what kind of character you want to make. You can focus on magic AND physical attacks, or stamina etc etc. For so early in the development, the game is quite vast and varied. It's not common I find a game of this caliber.

 I've already sunk 20+ hours into it like it's nothing and I can see myself sinking at least a couple hundred more hours into it easily. The only down side is now I have less time for other games. But it's just the thing if you're looking for something to do during this lockdown. At this rate, it'll be done and overwith before I know it thanks to this game.

 Even the $18 price tag is more than fair given the amount of content in this game. Especially after the last update. I admit, the quests are a bit dull so far. But have improved somewhat with the new version. There was one part where I accidentally sold a quest item and was unable to get it back, so that I was unable to complete the quest, but the quest remains in my journal. So I'm kinda stuck with that. But that's no longer a problem with the update.

 My only other problem is any time I try to Google anything about the game, I end up getting crap about some Sims 4 expansion with the same name, or other games that are irrelevant to this. But I guess a lack of online material is to be expected with a game so early on in its life. And has nothing to do with the overall quality of the game itself. It's just not something I've had an issue with before.

 I'll just end this by saying, even if the devs abandoned any more work on the game at this point, I would be satsisfied with it. But to the contrary, they've announced they're taking more time with the latest update to make sure it's as polished as possible. So it sounds like they're really putting their all into this. I can't state enough how highly I recommend this game.

[edit] Since the new update has come out, the game is MUCH bigger. There's a lot more in terms of quests and they're a bit more varied. Although a lot of them, at least in the early game consist of either fetching something or clearing enemies from an area. I would like to see more variation on the quests in the future. But it's not really a huge deal.

I'm really glad they took their time with this update, as it definitely shows. Despite a few spelling and grammatical errors, you can tell they put a lot of work into the fine details.

 Thus far I have logged almost 110 hours on the game and it's still just as fun as it was when I first played it. Though I know another update's probably a long way off. I already can't wait for it. And I hope the devs take their time with it just as much (or more so) than with this last one. Because that extra time is definitely worth the extra quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079487221', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1679107960}

author: {'steamid': '76561198797833309', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1589345158}
review: Started to get into the game alot, loved the character system but the movement in the game just seems a little too difficult, and somewhat clunky. The stamina system is not very well balanced, if you cannot even swing at enemies at that point when your stamina is low, you just die. Also speaking of npcs, the npcs have very aggressive movement, and their swings are hard to predict, and do too much damage; which I don't enjoy since i wanted to have a fun combat system, seeing how the game is made with this artstyle. Other than that, the game is "OK". If you want a 2D RPG that has elements in this game, id suggest just to play something like terraria.
developer_response: Hi, it seems to us that you had some major issues with the overall balance of the game along with our previous combat, stamina and AI systems. The game has changed a lot in the past few months and we are constantly working on improving it. We are proud to inform you that all of these major systems (combat, stamina, skill trees, enemy AI) has been reworked and greatly improved upon. We hope that you will give our game another chance and revisit its current version as we believe that it might offer you a better gaming experience than a couple of months ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008265661', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1651016264}
review:
Stay away if you get frustrated when nothing is explained.   You'll find little to help you understand any of the game's mechanics.  There's lots to build, but no explanation of where you can put what you've built.  There are a large number of "placeable" objects, but no indication of how to place it.  Beginning mobs are way overpowered.   Then there are just the obnoxious elements, which are probably intended to be funny, but a guy chasing you wanting to sniff your hair is not funny beyond the first time and maybe not then.  

If you're fine with dying and reloading whilst trying to figure out how to do things, then this game's for you.  For me, I didn't find the promise of more fun to come worth the aggravation.  My only regret is that I went past the refund period, thinking that surely the next bit would be better.
developer_response: Hi, we are sorry that the previous iteration of the game brought you frustration by being unable to properly explain its own mechanics. Avoiding such situations is one of the main reasons why we are constantly working on improving its overall state. We believe that in the past few months we have made some notable improvements (brand new tutorial, in-game pop-ups explaining various mechanics) that might be able to make another gaming experience with the new and improved version of the game way more enjoyable for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137756293', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1700626233}
review:
Perfect for someone who wants a strong progression line alongside DANG solid crafting.

Crafting is quick, easy, fun (or tolerable if you're a filthy casual) and is quite realistic. Doors need hinges and locks, tables need nailing together, etc.
Constant drive to craft more, more, more. New recipes are worth crafting. Very few things have no uses (all cups can be used to hold water!)
Farming is a little slow. Grass keeps growing on top of my crops. Have not had many crops ready to harvest as of yet. Likely am planning on editing thru XML.
Modding is stupidly easy. Poke numbers to your liking in the file the item exists in, [b]you're done![/b]
Workshop and patching system would be a great addon. I'd love to make mods that increase pickaxe speed/speed up crop growth etc.
Combat is genuinely stressful. You're insane if you don't panic when your health is low. Especially when you have no potions. It's super fast, reflex-based and high-stakes.
Don't worry, I'm a pacifist and I don't fight in games often, combat is not a turnaway.
Community is lacking. I feel kinda bad because of that. I'm planning on uploading videos for this game.
Quests are unique-feeling. They have reasoning and backstory. They seem like genuine tasks you have been assigned to.
Overall, I'd give it a range of 6-9/10. 6/10 in community and support (farming lag?), and 8-9/10 for everything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045765418', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 3337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1669149010}
review:
Well, if you play'd Terraria or Starbound you will feel like in home.

You choice race, name and look of your avatar. And land in tutorial. This is ok, it's teaching you want you need.

Game in in fantasy medieval world with own lore and stuff. It's cool that you don't need choice tools, you jsut use them. Need them in your character equipment and that's all. Same with food and water, you just choice what you want and equip. And food amount is impresive. Plenty to choice from.

You gather resourcers, make stuff. You must unlock it with your professions. What is really dope. You have character level and profession levels. Every CL you get skill point, you put it in magic skills, fighting, stamina and health, etc. When doing things like leatherworking or mining, farming, etc. You gather exp in your profession. Exp to CL you gather by quests, you have towns with npcs. You can trade and do quests from them. Other exp to CL is when Profession level up. And by killing mobs.

I must say, it's really good game but you really quickly gain enough strength and items. That you just don't need anything else. You just sit on your ass in home and farm, play with animals. And one problem here. You can have chickens, rabbits, goats and pigs. Problem is you can't take them from other map.

I mean, you have huge map, It's chunk based. Every chunk is one map you play on. You freely travel aroung them. To signpost if oyu unlock it or put it yourselfs if map is not block for building. Maps are level based, if you low level then better look out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400954601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1666162393}
review: poop

author: {'steamid': '76561197971041540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1703276066}
review:
Great mash up of Terreria, Starbound and old school NES. For an early access game, there's a lot to explore here. You can see where some of the polish needs to be applied but at 24hrs in, I've had a great time! Well worth the cost and the developers are still active.

Being a Path of Exile & Diablo fan, I'd love to see the implementation of randomized loot suffix's and prefix's but that's just my wishlist. There's plenty of items to craft and things to build. Keep up the development and I can't wait to see the finished product!

author: {'steamid': '76561198426155582', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1577042192}
review:
As i've seen a lot of other reviews point out, the games bland and while the premise sounds wonderful, the game just falls flat. I haven't played much as i got bored real quick.

PROS:
Immersive
Style is nice

CONS:
Tutorial is vague
Somewhat clunky
Quests are boring
No real reason to keep playing
Hard to pick up and grind with so little info on everything

If you're somewhat interested in this game, i think you're better off just playing something better, like Terraria, its cheaper and in my opinion is 10 times more polished than this game at the current moment
developer_response: Hi, we would like to inform you that the game has indeed changed a lot since the time of this review and hopefully we addressed basically every point from your “cons” list. We have introduced a brand new tutorial, we are constantly working on balancing issues and hope that the game is now easier to pick up and isn’t that clunky. We would really appreciate it if you could check the new version for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066263905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1708887069}
review:
This game is coming along nicely. If possible, I'd like more skill trees to be added, Quest NPC locations to always be specified in the journal, an option to examine an item and see exactly what it's used in, and the ability to use talent points to directly influence stamina and mana. As of right now, there's really only an option to increase player health and regen and having to wait for your 50 mana to recharge takes time. 

Aside from these nitpicks, the game is pretty decent, and I look forward to see what they decide to add next!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044711117', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1577433823}
review:
It appears to have things you might want in a a certain game type, but it's quite surface level in most areas. Combat is poor, quests are simple albiet have a little bit of writing time put in. 
Upgrades both in skillpoints and new gear feel unimpressive. Crafting is out of place ark inspired spamming. 
This game doesn't know if it wants to be oblivion but is too shallow, or terraria but lacking in quality & fun.
Updates are sparse. Would not rec.
developer_response: Hi, we understand that the previous iteration of the game wasn’t really to your liking, however, a lot has changed since the time of this review. We have added a lot of new, way more frequent updates that improved many of the vital areas that you mention - reworked combat, redesigned skill trees, new areas, quest storylines, tons of new gear and rebalanced crafting. We hope that you will give this new version a chance and have a way better experience in the Old Kingdom this time around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994084998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1576755885}
review:
Very disappointed with this game.  
1) It is so damn dark.  And there is no option to up the lighting.  This is in the tutorial.
2) When I can't tell what my shovel/pick can or cannot dog, makes me very sad
3) Controls compared to games like Terraria... makes this game very unplayable.  

There could be an awesome game here but when I encounter basic stuff like lighting, using tools etc which you should not be building from scratch.  It works in other games, so use their commands.  I don't need a new way to play especially when your new method is not intuitive.

Really wanted to like the game but controls make it unplayable.  And I'm still in the turtorial.
developer_response: Hi, we are terribly sorry that the old tutorial made it impossible for you to properly enjoy and sink your teeth into this game. However, Realms of Magic has drastically improved over the last year or so and one of the new features is a brand new tutorial that hopefully does a better job of introducing you to the various game mechanics and the lore of the Old Kingdom. We hope that you will give this new version a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091766488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2424, 'last_played': 1626923760}
review:
Realms Of Magic has a TON of potential, arguably more potential than any other game in its genre right now, but its still very early in it's life, and there are a number of things that I'd like to see added. For now, though, whats there is good and shows promise, so I'd recommend it, certainly. 

The biggest problem with it at the moment is the fact that the best way to  get the highest tier equipment is to mine for it, which wouldn't be problem if mining in and of itself wasn't extremely tedious. I think the solution to this would be to add a skill tree for mining allowing the player to upgrade how many ores in a vein they can harvest at once, ultimately ending in harvesting the entire vein after mining one block. The skill tree could also include other passive abilities like the chance of harvesting multiple ores from a single block (like the fortune enchantment from minecraft) or adding buffs when mining ores/ discovering different types of ores (e.g. with the highest perk you'd have a low chance of finding mithril/cobalt from iron/copper). The skill trees are one of the biggest strengths of this game and I feel that they are under utilized for all of the professions there are in this game. 

I'm not saying that every profession should have a skill tree, but I think it only makes sense for some of them. Example: I can think of a handfull of perks for a farming based skill tree that merges agriculture, husbandry, and woodcutting. Alchemy and milling could make up a nice skill tree, and could possibly include a small set of perks for smelting. 

The cave update just came out last month and improved the game dramatically from when I first played the game, but I wish there were more ways to get into these caves and more to do with the items therein. I was really disappointed when I found I couldn't harvest any of the glowing crystals/mushrooms, building is a very important part of this genre and I didn't find much substance in that regard from realms, allowing the harvesting of decorative items like the crystals, adding more of those decorations, and adding more craftable decorations would help out a lot. I should note that, building wise, decorating is actively encouraged as it's one of the best ways to store clutter and ultimately makes your home look very nice, but there could stand to be more to make buildings stand out.

on the other hand, I think adding a house or a lot that you could purchase in town would make the town a lot more useful, I only stopped in town to drop off quests and sell to the vendor, which is probably what it was intended for, but with the RPG elements in this game, towns could be incredibly interesting. At the moment the towns are generic and the towns people react as if there is a reputation system (as far as I can tell, there isnt) and you're constantly mangling it. one moment the townspeople appluad me as a hero and the next they react to me with disgust. The shop keep tells me to get out of his sight before I talk to him then greets me as a friend! 
there are also a number of grammar and spelling errors, which I just wrote off as part of a weird occasional dialect, but I certainly wouldn't mind if they were fixed.

lastly, I'm certain that the devs have plans to expand the world map, which is great, because it felt a bit small, but I'd like if the travel feature was expanded, happening in sped up real time with occasional random encounters similarly to the first 2 fallout games handled travel. Adding mounts and carriages to speed up travel would add depth to the game and give gold more use, while random encounters would give more chances for experience and more reason to level up combat abilities and explore the world, making it seem bigger. At level 45 half of my levels were from smelting and a third were from quests.

I'm not expecting these changes soon, these things take time and this game seems to be a passion project, but it could be something to truly rival the likes of Terraria and Starbound, if not overcome them. I've played a handful of games from this genre and have over 1000 hours in Terraria, and this is the first game in the genre that I've played that I've felt could provide an experience as encapsulating as games like The Elder Scrolls or Fallout series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047262286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2549, 'last_played': 1627677783}
review:
TL;DR: An indie game that combines elements from The Elder Scrolls, Minecraft and Stardew Valley.

Realms of Magic is a niche game. Set in your average low-magic fantasy setting, this action RPG lets you grind to your heart's content in a number of ways: you can gather, harvest, hunt, mine and chop resources from the wilderness, craft items, build houses or farms, explore dungeons and sell the efforts of your labor to NPCs. As you perform these activities, you acquire talent points for customizing your character and turning them into a warrior, a mage or something in-between.

Combat is fun whether you wield a sword or cast spells. You are required to dodge and time your attacks appropriately depending on the simple attack patterns of the enemy. Stamina and magic point management is important, so mindlessly spamming spells or attacks is not advisable unless you invest in resource generation and cost reductions. Other activities like husbandry or crafting are simple but engaging as well: you can plant seeds, harvest crops, turn produce into animal feed, shear or butcher animals, and cook using the fruits of your labor, among other things.

Realms of Magic suffers from a common ailment in early-access indie games: a lack of content and depth. The world features only two biomes, plains and forests, and they are based on the same tileset. There are some dungeons and quests that add content to the world, and some background lore to discover, but most of what the game has to offer can be experienced in the first two hours of gameplay. These issues are being tackled by the developers in a slow but steady manner, with each content update adding modest but well-designed changes, so this assessment may change in the future.

If you enjoy simple sandbox games where you grind for power and fortune or just for a nice-looking castle, this game is worth it even in its early-access state. I, for one, like it very much as it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104268049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1692908391}

developer_response: Hi, we are terribly sorry that you found the previous iteration of the game rather boring. We are still working on improving it and adding brand new content. Just recently we have released a major update that overhauled most features in the game and added a ton of new content (including new gear, new realms to visit, new enemies, new quests etc.). We hope to convince you to give Realms of Magic another chance and personally experience the scope of these changes.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006412514', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 4222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1644012356}
review:
Terraria with a twist..

And I say this with great respect and love, since Terraria is one of my favourite games of all time.
So if you like Terraria/Starbound you will like this.
The twist is the RPG element and that you level up in Realms of Magic, doing quests, choosing skills etc. and that makes it a very interesting game (for me at least) since level up is one of my favourite things to do in all games.

I got nothing bad at all to say about Realms of Magic,, great game, well worth the money, can't wait to see the finished and polished product in 2020.
Hopfully there will be co-op someday for all the ppl that want that (haven't read anything so maybe it will or maybe not) would be nice though, Terraria is very fun with friends.

GG Devs, keep up the awsome work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271130670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1574738787}
review:
This review is being written right within 3 hours of purchase and play time.

Realms of Magic is something incredibly special. The game is a clear cross between Terraria and the Elder Scrolls, but the emphasis of the game leans way more towards the Elder Scrolls. I say this because while the aesthetic and gameplay is that of Terraria, the premise, immersion, quest elements and UI resembles and Elder Scrolls like game.

I'm going to just point out things within the game instead of giving pros and cons and leave it up to those who read this to decide for themselves, whether or not, this game peaks your interest:

- In-game time system like that of the Elder Scrolls.

- You must "Rest" in a bed in order to pass time.

- Talent Tree Skill System

-  10 Playable Races
   (Humans, Wild Elves, High Elves, Dark Elves, Orcs, Dwarves, Goblins, Gnomes, LIzardmen, and Cursed.)

- Bag Slot Inventory System,

- Intricate Crafting System

   (Example: To make a door, you need Wood, Hinges, and Nails, not just wood)

- Simple Buffs and Debuffs

- Many potions for many things

- Farming in a 2D game that really works.

- Most of the NPCs have quests for you to take on

- the World is actually HUGE, and traveling is unique.
   (Example: You don't just keep moving left and enter a different biome. You must reach the end of your current area, and them press M to then move to the next Tile on the massive world map.)

- Vendor NPCs have their own amount of currency. Sell to much to them and they may run out of money.

And there is probably so much more I'm missing from here, but these are things I thought stood out.

It's only Alpha and there's already so much to offer and do in the game, and the price is definitely worth it. My hopes are high for this game and I believe the developers haven't even scratched the surface of what they'd like their finished product to be. If you're into these types of games, most definitely give this game a go. It's Elder Scrolls Sandbox 2D if you ask me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104135563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1655613363}
review:
更新了好多内容，可惜2021年了还是没有中文，耐着性子边查边玩，主线做到了倒数第二个图，任务竟然卡在了找广场上的人，最后一个地图碎片也得不到，不走主线又不能开图，一气之下只能卸载。*****************************************真希望官方能出中文****************************
不光出中文还能出多人，毕竟系统做这么丰富，光一个炼金术做药就那么多种。又是加工皮革又是纺织又是冶炼锻造的那么多职业，每个做东西还被职业等级卡的死死的，现在更新之后练职业的技能又不加升级经验导致我这种在宅家里种地做东西的玩家升级成了幻想。还得出去打怪才能获取经验。体验不如早期好了。早期地图也不会锁，想去哪就去哪。任务想做就做不想做就不做。真的够开放。现在想开地图必须做主线或者打怪下矿找宝箱搜地图碎片合成。升级经验还那么多。期待新版本
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
喜欢这种风格的画面，人物动物植物背景都不错，音乐也有待丰富，特别是当初想养动物早期版本并没有，但是现在更新之后可以饲养了，真的很高兴，唯一让我难受的是植物的生长设定，需要人物在游戏里度过的时间才算，对于上班族来说，可能一波植物想长成都需要很久，希望官方可以考虑改变一下

author: {'steamid': '76561198046211703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1592229363}
review: Good start to the game for being in Early Access. Could use more variety in the skill trees instead of just % increases, but for now I thought it was lots of fun. Basically makes me think Terraria with some race/class options and spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125554980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 8331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7612, 'last_played': 1700660236}
review: Realms of Magic is a fantastic small indie survival/Rpg. The game itself is like a tiny version of skyrim. You can play different races and classes, with many skill trees to choose from. The setting is a lovly developt fantasy world were you have different quest´s and a mainstory to play. You can craft alot of things, like armors, weapons, furniture etc. And when this is not enough for you, you also have the option to build your very own House. I had a lot of fun with the game. If you like games like starbound or terraria then give this game a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021436421', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1602442409}
review:
La verdad es que lo jugue muy poquito, ya que el juego parece tener mucho lore y lamentablemente tengo un ingles un poco basico... asi que me cuesta bastante seguirle el ritmo. De todas maneras y habiendo juegado muchos juegos de este tipo (terraria, starbound, entre otros), creo que el juego tiene su magia y estilo propio. Apuesto por su potencial y ojala pronto saquen una traduccion al español. Saludos.

Actualizo... Mas de 4 años después, el juego fue dado por terminado. Nunca se molestaron en traducirlo (y seguramente nunca lo hagan). Cambio a negativo...

author: {'steamid': '76561198101578612', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1672727926}
review:
It took me two hours to get endgame gear.
I murdered a lot of stuff.
Took everyones' heads.
I then made chickens mate.
Overall I think this game needs more balancing. Especially for the Cursed who are supposed to be at war with the undead, but in-game they really just don't attack or anything of the such. I really do like this game but can tell it's in early access. Like I said it just needs some balancing and a higher difficulty overall. (Death doesn't really effect you and combat is insanely easy. Even so I give it an 8/10 for the potential and fun time I had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008905242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1673567907}
review:
Me encanta este juego, faltan algunas cosas por pulir sobre todo en ciertas animaciones, pero tiene tanto contenido y evolución de personaje que es genial el juego, si siguen sacando mas ramas de talentos y algunas profesiones mas sería perfecto el juego. 9/10

Cosas positivas:
- Amplio contenido.
- Ramas de talentos y evolución en profesiones. 
- Muchas horas de juego. 
- Hay variedad de razas a escoger en creación de personaje.

Cosas negativas: 
- Visualmente puede no ser atractivo. 
- Puede basarse en grindeo a veces y hacerse algo repetitivo (según la raza inicial que cojas).

En general es un juego de echar bastantes horas y siguen sacando contenido a si que dará para mucho mas en un futuro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980619199', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1630449731}
review:
Grind grind grind for the sake of grind.
Dunno why developers implement "gates" and content locking same way as mobile games.

All "higher" tier content, and especially dungeons you see on preview require quite prolonged grind to access.
Ofc you can just move into endgame dungeon with level 1 character, but you won't survive.

All crafting hardgated and game forces you to craft thing you do not need and do not want, just to access next tiers.
You already have "stone tools", but game "strongly advice" to craft them again (and drop) just to get access to other crafting recipes.
This makes lower tier materials mandatory and higher tier materials locked behind grindwall.

Just imagine Minecraft that prevent you from crafting stone tools before you crafted wooden ones 20 times.
Then it prevents you from crafting iron tools before crafting stone ones 20 times...
Or early versions of Terraria that require all previous tiers of tools\weapons\armors to craft next ones.
Want iron armor? Kay, craft wooden, then tin, then copper, then bronze and only then iron armor.
Don't have tin? No iron armor for you.

Probably some people feel sense of pride and accomplishment, when game decided to give long awaited "priveledge" to access next tier of content, but this is not how games on PC should work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991063358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1590843102}
review:
Awesome game! 
Getting better and better at each update.
It is a slower paced Terraria clone but, in my opinion, with way better mechanics. The combat feels way more rewarding. Character progression is also a thing in this game.

Worth way more than the full price.
If you like Terraria, Medieval games and combat with spells and dodge then get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345944259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1710386242}
review: La verdad me parece que es un juego muy completo. Siendo que es muy sencillo en algunas cosas, pero "Complicado" donde debe de serlo, simplemente con la finalidad de mejorar la jugabilidad. He visto varios juegos de Rol que no ofrecen esta hermosa experiencia de juego. Con cosas como ir mejorando tu habilidades con el uso, explorando, construyendo, recolectando, cazando, limpiando mazmorras, mejorando tu equipo, aprendiendo magia e interactuando con los PNJ, podrías sencillamente no darte cuenta de que jugaste hasta las 6 AM. 100% recomendado a los amantes del Rol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050294689', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1658512423}
review:
Magic is right! I knew as soon as I started the game and heard the music, then saw character creation, the background for the scenes, ui and menus... this game is very special. It's the kind of game i've always wanted to play but missed out on and could never find any new game like it. I love the focus on crafting, farming, building, npc quests, story etc... it's very refreshing and exactly what's missing from so many games available now. I like to play at my own pace and do what I want in any particular play session. There is so much attention to detail put into this game, and it's one of my favorite indies. 

Just a quick note to potential customers, this game is not like Terraria just because it is side scrolling, the similarity ends there. This is an RPG first and foremost. Please don't judge games strictly based on things like that or you do developers a disservice. Reviewing a game negatively because it didn't meet your unreasonable expectations is not fair. Do some research on games before you purchase them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025021349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 11314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 204, 'playtime_at_review': 2873, 'last_played': 1711547585}
review:
While it's still obviously in Early Access and not totally finished I've already put twenty hours into this game at the point of this review. I enjoy this type of game, and I can say that this one is far more in depth than the ones I've played recently. 

Most satisfying is the leveling system. You have character level ups, then you have your skill level ups. There's crafting and building but neither is required. If it's more to your taste you can just buy or loot gear so you don't actually have to craft, build ect. 

There's no doubt in my mind that I'll lose countless more hours to this game and I'm looking forward to what's added later on. 

10 / 10 would stash 100 heads in a chest at a farmhouse again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348099627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1616863241}
review: muito bom

author: {'steamid': '76561198022866997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1544135056}
review:
Out of all the new/new-ish/EA games in the 2D RPG Sandbox genre, this is probably one of the most feature complete, bug free, games out right now.  Updates seem to be fairly steady and overall gameplay isn't too bad either.

The game brings some differenct mechanics to the table - unlike Terreria with a long flat (not terrain) world or Starbound with a round world you can walk around, in this game you have sectors that you travel between using a map.  I wasn't sure I'd like this system, but find that I like it more than walking completely around a world as it makes the world feel much larger. Also, the way the zones are setup, you can even visit the empty areas on the map and find things to do.  Once you unlock signposts you can even travel right to your base instead of to the edges of that zone.

Right now magic seems limited (fire-based only?) and combat (melee and magic) feels really stiff, but the it isn't a dealbreaker - needs more balance and fluidity though.  Another thing that needs tweaking - you can't place potions into the combat hotbar, which seems rather odd as you have to switch back to exploration mode to then use them (unless I'm doing something wrong).

Progression seems slow initially, but I feel that this is actually a good thing in the long run.  Many games try to rush you through things and you end up unlocking all the craftables long before you even approach the endgame.  As for the craftables, it seems like it will be a rather decent number, but I haven't peeked at the items I haven't learned yet even though the game allows this.

Things are also very open ended - you don't need to follow a linear path on a timeclock to proceed.  There does appear to be some sort of individual story elements via NPC quests, but not sure if those come together later or not (UPDATE: I'm beginning to think that there isn't or isn't much of a story here - if you like to make your own then you should be fine, otherwise...).

One thing that is a limitation of 2D games in this genre - building multiple structures in a way that doesn't frustrate you.  Moving through towns requires opening doors, which you can leave open thereafter, but unless you build your own constructions on 'stilts' (ugly) or underground, things can interrupt your movement.  Fortunately I don't think this game has raids like in Terreria, so leaving the doors open appears to be fine for now.

For $10 this game appears to deliver quite a bit already and some other EA games with way less content and features are charging twice this amount.  You can enjoy the game for several hours now, but hopefully development will continue, combat will be tweaked, more features added, and this will end up being a nice addition to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994356907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1542761333}
review:
Obligatory disclaimer: I do realize this is early access, alpha, yadda yadda yadda.

That said, I just got hit by what I consider a game-breaking bug. I built two pine chests and unloaded all of my cloth and seeds into one of them and all of my hides into the other.

When I came back a day later, the chest with hides still had items in it, but the chest with cloth and seeds was now empty. I checked my autosaves (why does this game insist on creating a new autosave every time I load, anyway?) and from what I can tell, the chest contents disappeared shortly after I placed the items in it, possibly before I even left my base.

Crafting and accumulation of items is the heart of this game. If that doesn't work, everything else is pointless. Unfortunately, I can't request a refund anymore, but if I could, I totally would. Perhaps this will be a great game someday. As of today, however, I rate it "hot garbage".
developer_response:
Hey! We are deeply sorry that such gamebreaking bug happened to you. Bugs that cause players to lose progress are completely unacceptable and fixing them is top priority for us.

We will be more than happy to talk about solving your problem directly. Please contact us at support@polishedgames.com.

It would be also extremely helpful for us if you could email us your saves so we could analyze them and fix this bug. Saves are found in Realms of Magic folder in My Documents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401650845', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2002, 'last_played': 1655303045}
review:
I adore Realms of Magic. It’s as if two of my favorite games combined, ElderScrollsV: Skyrim, and Starbound. It is a true hidden gem. If you like fantasy games(Elderscrolls, DnD, Zelda, Anything Tolkien-esc) or sandbox games (Minecraft, Starbound, Terraria etc.) This is a game for you. It is one of my favorite games ever, the only thing beating it are giants like Mario Odyssey and various Zeldas. Well let’s get into the meat.

	The game has a great level system, getting a point or two every level to expand your talent tree. There are many options to flesh out your character. Character creation itself is pretty expansive, with a bunch of races and plenty of hairstyles and such. Your character is just plopped down after the tutorial, where admittedly it's a bit slow at the beginning, no execution or kidnapped sisters here, but that doesn’t exclude it from having a fantastic story. No, the story is great and a lot of the sidequests really bring everything full circle. Some quests are fetching food so the family won’t starve through winter while others are about taking out bandit gangs, which is a fantastic experience because of the combat system. The combat is snappy, yet realistically slow, it feels good to play. Well maybe it feels so good due to the epic jams by Tomasz Depczynski you listen to throughout. Your loot must go somewhere, so thats where base building comes in. Base building is intricate, with various furniture peices and the animal husbandry. I think more types ofblocks and such would be nice, but its well rounded. You could also sell the loot. Selling is decently put together, but most merchants aren't worth visiting.

The game is a true diamond in the rough of fantasy RPGs and sandbox games. I hope you can experience the magic that is this indie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028273979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1605798247}

11/10 Doing early access right

author: {'steamid': '76561198124335620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1562561429}
review:
ive enjoyed this a lot so far. really fantastic game. it may look very similar to other titles, but this game offers a completely unique experience. the game has surprisingly comfortable pacing-- you can rush into situations and missions or take your time. all of the menus are really convenient to use, and there are features set in place (such as the passive eating and drinking feature) that fix a lot of monotony that is so often tied to this type of game.

i definitely do recommend this title 9/10

some things that i would really like to see:
more fluid combat
multiplayer
full procedurally generated map (instead of just procedural sub-locations)

the game can still thrive without these features, but i think they would be great additions

author: {'steamid': '76561198037973300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 15739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8098, 'last_played': 1662909792}
review: I've enjoyed the game quite a bit.  I think they're adding new stuff, and fixing problems, at a good rate.  I think this will be a great game for those who enjoy this style when it's complete.  If you're the right temperment to deal with a work in progress, it's a great game now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053755337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2005, 'last_played': 1538222682}
review:
I have always enjoyed rpg games, ever since Zelda was released 21 November 1991, on the snes, thats the Super  Nintendo to all you young folk. Right away i found a game that hooked me, so when i brought Realms Of Magic i didn't expect another game to hook me again but it has. For a Alpha game the content is incredible, it offers far more
than Terraria ever could, and i even might go as far as saying this game is what Terraria should of been. From the character creation screen the choices seem almost infinite, its very nicely put together, and the starting tutorial helps the new rpg players find there feet. Like i said it a Alpha game but the quests are enjoyable, the farming is fun, even the combat very well put together, and grab your pickaxe and shovel because in Realms Of magic you need
to go mining deep down in the earth, and find those ores to craft better weapons and armor, gather resources and build you base, Realms Of Magic is a great game so what are you waiting for.... go on!!! go buy it Now!!!
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197990887353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1658866458}
review: Приятная игра, клон террарии и старбаунда. Человечек может иметь разные расы с разными бонусами к крафту. Кроме стартовой локации есть еще несколько сотен других с рзаными мобами. Часть из локаций неизменяема, там города, подземелья и т.п. В городах можно брать квесты и торговать. Задумка в общем отличная, но через пару часов становится скучновато. Квестов мало, живность не регенерирует, ночью враги не приходят. Пока террария и craft the world остаются лидерами.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112178736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1644507225}
review:
great game even if it's still early access. good job so far, devs.

i'm a fan of other sandbox games like terraria, starbound, dig or die, etc.. so this game is totally up my alley.

although at of the moment of this writing, the only "projectile" weapon available in this game is a fireball spell, so the lack of archery makes it difficult to chase down the low-hp enemies that are running scared of my blade, unless i try roasting them with a fireball.

i'm also a fan of immersive survival stuff, like food decay, injuries, sickness, item deterioration, hot/cold temperatures, traps, floods, structural integrity, etc.. though this game doesn't seem to have any of those at the moment.

i'll probably update this when this game gets significant new updates, but for an early access game, it's enjoyable enough and likely worth the price (especially when on sale)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054501073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3237, 'last_played': 1682891327}
review:
I feel like this game has more potential then most craft/survival games that are out there. This was alot of fun to play through with some polishing and more content it really could take the market by storm. 

Pros: I love the map aspect, crafting felt smooth with a hint of grinding added along. I didn't feel like waiting was a burden.
mele combat was perfect. Resource management is key but not over powered.

Cons: There's nothing to use or do with early tier items after you surpass them, and just selling everything seems hollow. Money felt like it had no point by the end I had over 25 gold and no clue as to what to do with it. Early game combat is very unforgiving this is a con and a pro. 

Over all I would and will continue to play this title as well as reccomend it to friends and family.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338492074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1660366223}
review:
This game is relatively good, I would recommend it definitely, it's given me a lot of fun. One thing is that it could be considered somewhat lackluster, not extremely, but to some extent. The updates have definitely helped the game overall, and I see potential for it being a great game.

One last thing I must say is a con of the game is the different crafting trees, and having to level them each up to craft something is annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148502495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2502, 'last_played': 1710790539}
review: I have been playing this game for a few days now and can say that it has ALOT of promise for the future and I have been loving it big time! Sure it can be a bit grindy and what not but its worth it in the long run to do the grinding to get to where you can make the really good equipment,food, and potions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071241363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1553266123}
review: It's a decent game, someone said that if it keeps up with development, it might beat Terraria, I could see that in a few years probably. My only complaint is that the game is called Realms of Magic, but the only spellcasting skill tree is Pyromancy (which by the way specifies fire spells as fire spells specifically) and that's kind of disappointing as of the time being.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990188583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 6655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2283, 'last_played': 1677590895}
review:
Unfortunately the released version of game is more a disappointment, than a worth recommendation product. The game improved a bit, but somehow went a completely wrong as for my taste way.

Do you like Terraria more than Starbound? You will dislike this game then.

+ Terraria-like game.
+ Massive craft and many resources to gather.
+ RPG system with character level, professions levels, many skills.
+ Quests and many dialogues.
+ Big upgradable inventory.

- Skills are not motivating, some skills offer a slight boost, but can't really catch up with rising of the difficulty in a new act.
- Hybrid builds are barely possible due to lack of skill points and each skill tree passives boos only that tree.
- No synergies, e.g. earlier summons become absolutely useless and waste of point later on.
- Poor combat system, it just doesn't fit, melee feels too clunky and on higher zoom kind of hard, summons AI is really terrible, enemies will agro through walls, etc.
- Poor balance: many game mechanics left unbalances in certain tier branches.
- Way too much of "protected" zones, in Starbound this was mainly used for boss fights, here the whole quest chain progress through such zones. Sandboxes zones (where you can build and destroy) are non-interesting, feels as not fitting aspect. After completing a game it feels not like Terraria, rather like some sort of Metroidvania. Not what I expect or enjoy.
- Later in game level designs begin repeating self, sure it's a whopping number of handmade levels, but seeing same 2 cave entranced with exit door inside not so wide map is .. boring.
- Poor crafting UI, workbench is a scroll-hell, the crafting stations can't remember last recipem, nor filters, constant scrolling, too few filters, useless categories..
- Too many rapidly jumping enemies, they are not hard, they are annoying. Either a spellcaster who can jump half-screen away or a warg charging 3 times in a row.
- Bugs: a lot of bugs, breaking bugs, bugs preventing you from getting achievements,soft-locking bugs, even auto-save system is buggy and unusable.
- Game offer just one (!) fight with the boss mechanics. Whole game is filled with dozen elites, which are basically meaty versions of other bosses, sometimes with unique model..
- No official wiki. For a game of this scale with thousands of items, npcs, locations, etc. official wiki is a must have.
- Useless notes with hits to find secrets.
- "The Library" endgame quest which require you to bring several books, which aren't marked as quest, can't be crafted, are easily sold as a crap to npcs and don't appears to be respawnable/lootable.
- Enemy shouts (looks like huge tooltips floating above for quite some time) will obscure vision, no way to distinguish enemy from own summon, one-shotting attacks of certain enemies without a way to avoid them, difficulty to see dangerous enemy in a crowd, huge packs of enemies in sandbox maps of last biomes... I can write and write small, but very annoying things, which makes this game feels very unpolished and poorly thought.

I was enjoying the start of the game, first 2-3 acts feels ok. But then I understand that would be the whole game like this: boring protected levels with boring stupid mobs, primitive secrets to find (it's fun only first few maps). Even quests at some point become not fun anymore, especially when you have to move between 2 locations back and forth dozens of time.

Compared to my first impressions when playing EA 4 years ago, the released version fails miserably. I was expecting middle-age Terraria with nice skills. But I got somewhat boring journey filled with repeatable and poorly balanced content, which still require years of polishing and bugfixes.

Not sure to whom recommend this game.


Below is my positive EA review Posted: 24 Jul, 2018 @ 9:34pm

---

For an alpha game offers quite a lot. 

It's not as good as Terraria or Starbound, but in my oppinion it easily beat any other Terraria-like game: Sign of life, Planet Centauri, Dig or die, Crea.

Starbound is the closest analogue, same system of locked maps (aka dungeons) and free-to-dig ones. Same map with huge amount of pretty big maps to explore.

Game mechanics is interesting: there are active skills, e.g. fireball and passive (+life, +fire damage, etc.), which are formed in a kind of skill trees in several categories (melee, magic, etc.). Sill points are granted on level-ups. Experience is gained for increasing craft level, completing quest or simply killing enemies.

Enemies are sparse and game is balanced towards challenging fight even against a single opponent. Pulling too many enemies may make the victory a hard job. The main quest line will will lead through the game, increasing in the difficulty.

As an alpha the game has many cons:
- AI is very bad and sometimes very annoying;
- Most of environment is a forest (biomes are not yet a thing);
- poor UI;
- loot is too generic;
- poor balance;
- mediocre skills: no variety, rudimental choices (e.g. increase inventory skills are must).

I have hope this game will make it to the release and  the release will be a comparable to what Terraria was 5 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032726338', 'num_games_owned': 1788, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1628391944}
review:
An interesting game that at the moment doesnt feel optimized (games that should be far more demanding run better on my laptop.) This is likely going to be fixed in future updates. I have not played much of the game due to my huge backlog, but i like most of what i have seen so far.
 The only thing i currently dont enjoy is the combat which feels a little clunky, but an overhaul is coming this year.
overall I would say buy on sale unless you really love the 2d sandbox genre or really want to support the devs (and you should).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043198608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1678458213}
review:
Bought the game at Summer Sale and what can I say?
Well, as a huge fan of Terraria-like games I couldn't pass this one. It is sure a complex and fun game that features such things as:
- Tradeskills (Your skills develop, as you use them)
- Complexity (If you want a table - wood is not enough. You need nails as well)
- Variety of characters (Not sure what those races do, but it's fun to know you can play as Goblin instead of puny human).
- Vast talent system (Looks amazing. Some of the perks give you movement speed, others = bag slots, combat damage, etc)

There are some things I didn't like: for example - wolves on early start won't lose you once they see you. Yep, they will follow you no matter what and kill you. If you run to your respawn point and die by wolf there - guess who'll meet you as you respawn? :)
Also, the digging/cutting/lumbering feels a bit slow (especially if you start to play after Starbound or similar game).

But as for now the game has that addictive feel that promises I will spend hours in this game. Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066869158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1561915901}
review:
Realms of Magic (reviewing pre-alpha version 0.3) is a promising game that merges clever crafting elements akin to Terrarria and Starbound with a questing and exploration RPG that offers character development in skills and experience. I've played just about 18 hours of the game as of writing the review, and I have thoroughly enjoyed the game play so far. 

What this game does right comes in the form of most of the game play -- the leveling skills and experience, talents, the interface, the general character movement, map exploration, NPC interactions, crafting, farming, and resource management, and so on. Even in its early stages, this game offers a lot to do, and frames the activities through character development and interaction with the world map. 

Where I would like to see development is in the options available in all of the noted elements of game play, as well as addressing the writing, sprite movement, combat AI, and the variability and size of the world map itself. Many of the issues that make the game clunky right now, though, are the result of this game being so early in its development. According to the developers' roadmap, most of the issues I have with the game are scheduled to be addressed, so if they stay committed to developing the game I see no reason why Realms of Magic wouldn't become a welcome addition to the Terrarria / Starbound / Stardew Valley community. Primarily, Realms of Magic offers a character development and progression experience that is only available in small form (or with mods) in other similar games. 

If you like crafting and building and exploring, and you backing games in early development, then this is worth the buy now. If you're more likely not to take the risk on a game so early on, put this one on your wishlist and pick it up when it grows a bit more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090189496', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1590694570}
review:
Loved Starbond and Subnautica, liked Crea, hated Terraria, played PixelArk etc. Realms of Magic, as a pre-alpha (as devs claim), is well polished game, but still there is a lot of features yet to be implemented (see dev's Roadmap post). 

What differs this game from tons of similar? 
1) Quests. No randomly generated stuff that is repetitive. Meaningfull nice quests with equally meaningfull backstroy. They aren't complex, but yet they give a nice flavor.
2) Map. You enter a little mini-zone from the map. You can find ruins or inhabitetd villages. You can choose one of those in the wilds and build your home there. A lot of "squares" await your visit

What I like in the game:
- pleasant art
- enjoyable music
- quests


What I dislike for now:
- combat - too slow, too weak armor, too big damage from enemies
- only one biome (devs have plans to add more)
- not much under the ground level (same as above)

I see a potential here. Maybe you could give it a chance too?

author: {'steamid': '76561197965811013', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1656888847}
review: Bought this today, 6 hours later I stopped to eat. Now I'm headed back in. It's like an rpg + terraria. Not like a terraria + rpg. If that makes any sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014913462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1608131188}
review: Dont try to reinvent the wheel, take what made Terraria effective and make it better. Dont take backkwards steps such as separate "modes" for tools and weapons. Also, with a campfire, sticks, and raw chicken I should be able to cook.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984361762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1617444253}
review:
Good base implementation for single player Terraria style game. It's not ready yet, but has a lot good features and fun to play already.

Pros :
* Easy to play, good simple UI
* Gathering, crafting, building etc works fine already and are fun
* Moving between different instances via map is good idea
* Wilds, NPC villages, dungeons etc. different style instances
Cons :
* Not ready yet
* Some animations look strange
* Quick bar does not work with all needed items (like potions) and it behaves strangely sometimes
* Currently needs more content and some fixing

All cons are something that probably will be fixed when game is ready. Devs are active and doing good job at a moment, so I think I can recommend this game already. It's cheap enough as it is, so get it now if early access is not problem for you or wait until it's ready.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064634702', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1572684917}
